كان للنبي زوجات، اختارهن الله -سبحانه- ليكن أمهات المؤمنين، وليحملن عبء الدعوة مع الرسول ( وهن: خديجة بنت خويلد -رضي الله عنها-، وكانت أول زوجة للنبي (، ولم يتزوج غيرها، حتى توفيت.
وسودة بنت زمعة -رضي الله عنها-، وقد تزوجها الرسول ( بعد خديجة. ثم تزوج عائشة بنت أبي بكر -رضي الله عنها-. ثم تزوج زينب بنت خزيمة -رضي الله عنها-، وتوفيت عنده (. ثم تزوج أم سلمة هند بنت أبي أمية، وهي آخر نسائه موتًا.
ثم تزوج زينب بنت جحش ابنة عمته، التي كانت زوجة لزيد بن حارثة مولى رسول الله (، وكان الله -سبحانه- هو وليها الذي زوجها لرسول الله، وتوفيت في أول خلافة عمر. وتزوج ( جويرية بنت الحارث، ثم تزوج أم حبيبة رملة بنت أبي سفيان، وقد تزوجها الرسول ( وهي ببلاد الحبشة، وقد دفع النجاشي صداقها، وقدره أربعمائة دينار، وماتت في أيام أخيها معاوية.
وتزوج صفية بنت حيي بن أخطب سيد بني النضير، ثم تزوج ميمونة بنت الحارث الهلالية، وهي آخر من تزوج بها.
سراريه:
وكان من سراريه ( مارية القبطية، وريحانة، وجارية وهبتها له زينب بنت جحش، وجارية أخرى أصابها في بعض السبي.
أولاده :
وكان له ( من الأولاد القاسم، وزينب، وعبد الله، وإبراهيم، ورقية، وأم كلثوم، وفاطمة، وكل أولاده من خديجة -رضي الله عنها- إلا إبراهيم، فإنه كان من مارية القبطية.
صفة النبي:
كان رسول الله ( فخمًا مفخمًا، يتلألأ وجهه تلألؤ القمر ليلة البدر، ليس بالطويل ولا بالقصير، عظيم الهامة، شعره رجل بين الجعودة والسبوطة، فيه تكسير قليل، وافر يجاوز شحمه أذنيه. واسع الجبين، له نور يعلوه، كثيف اللحية، شديد سواد العين، سهل الخدين، ورقيق الأسنان، بين أسنانه فتحات، عريض الصدر، بعيد ما بين المنكبين، ضخم رؤوس العظام، أشعر الذراعين والمنكبين وأعالي الصدر، رحب الراحة، أملس القدمين ليس فيهما تكسر ولا شقاق، سريع المشية إذا مشى كأنما ينحط من منحدر، وإذا التفت التفت كله.
منطقه :
كان ( دائم الفكر، ليست له راحة، لا يتكلم في غير حاجة، طويل السكوت، يتكلم بجوامع الكلم، يعظم النعمة وإن كانت صغيرة، لا يذم منها شيئًا ولا يمدحه، لا يغضب لنفسه، ولا ينتصر لها، إذا أشار أشار بكفه كلها، وإذا تعجب قلبها، معظم ضحكه أن يبتسم.
دخوله :
كان ( إذا دخل منزله قسم دخوله ثلاثة أجزاء، جزءًا لله، وجزءًا لأهله، وجزءًا لنفسه،ثم جزء جزءه بينه وبين الناس، فرد ذلك على العامة والخاصة، لا يدخل عنهم شيئًا.
مجلسه:
كان ( لا يجلس ولا يقوم إلا ذاكرًا لله تعالى، يجلس حيث انتهى به المجلس، يعطي كل جلساته نصيبًا، لا يرى في مجلسه أكرم منه، لا ينصرف من كان معه، من سأله حاجة لا يردَّه إلا بها، فإن لم يجد فبكلمة طيبة، كل الناس عنده في مجلسه سواء، فمجلسه مجلس حلم وحياء وصبر وأمانة، لا ترفع فيه الأصوات، ولا تذكر فيه العيوب، وكان في مجلسه دائم البشر، سهل الخلق، لين الجانب ليس بفظ ولا غليظ، ولا سخاب، ولا فحاش ولا عياب، ولا كثير المزاح، يتغافل عما لا يشتهي.
وكان ( في مجلسه يترك الناس من ثلاث: أن لا يذم أحدًا ولا يعيره، ولا يطلب عورته، ولا يتكلم إلا فيما يرجو ثوابه، يضحك إذا ضحك الحاضرون ويتعجب مما يتعجبون، ويصبر على الغريب على قسوته في كلامه ومسألته، ولا يقطع على أحد حديثه.
سكوته:
كان سكوته ( على أربع: الحلم، والحذر، والتقدير، والتفكير، فأما تقديره ففي تسويته النظر والاستماع بين الناس، وأما تفكره ففيما يبقى ويفنى، وجُمع له ( الحلم والصبر، فكان لا يغضبه شيء إلا إذا انتهكت محارم الله.
طعامه:
كان ( لا يرد من الطعام ما وجد، ولا يتكلف في طلب ما فقد، فما قرب إليه أكله، وإن عافته نفسه لا يعيبه وتركه، فكان ( يأكل ما تيسر، فإن لم يجد ما يأكله صبر، فكان يضع من الجوع على بطنه الحجر، ويمر الهلال بعد الهلال ولا يوقد في بيته نار، كانت الأرض سفرته، يضع عليها طعامه، وكان يأكل بثلاث أصابع وهو أشرف ما يكون في الأكل، فإن المتكبر يأكل بأصبع واحدة، والجشع يأكل بخمس.
وكان ( لا يأكل متكئًا، وكان يسمي الله تعالى أول الطعام، وبحمده آخره فيقول: "الحمد لله حمدًا طيباً مباركًا فيه غير مكفى ولا دموع ولا مستغنى عنه ربنا" [البخاري].
شربه :
كان ( يسمّي الله قبل الشرب، ويحمده بعده، وكان أكثر شربه قاعدًا، بل نهى عن الشرب قائمًا، وشرب مرة قائمًا، ليبين أنه يجوز لك إذا كان لحاجة أو عذر، وكان إذا شرب ناول من على يمينه، حتى لو كان من على يساره أكبر منه، لأنه ( يحب التيامن في كل شيء.
نومه :
كان ( ينام على الفراش تارة، وعلى الحصير تارة، وعلى الأرض تارة، وعلى السرير تارة، فعن عباد بن تميم عن عمه قال: رأيت رسول الله ( مستلقيًا في المسجد واضعًا إحدى رجليه على الأخرى" [متفق عليه]، وكان فراشه مصنوعًا من جلد قد حشي ليفًا، وكان إذا أراد النوم جمع كفيه ثم ينفث فيهما، ثم يقرأ فيهما (قل هو الله أحد) و (قل أعوذ برب الفلق) و (قل أعوذ برب الناس) ثم يمسح بهما ما استطاع من جسده، يبدأ بهما على رأسه، ووجهه، وباقي جسده، يفعل ذلك ثلاث مرات.[أبو داود والترمذي].
وكان ينام على جنبه الأيمن، ويضع يده اليمنى تحت خده، ثم يقول: "اللهمَّ قني عذابك يوم تبعث عبادك" [أبو داود والترمذي]، وكان يقول إذا أوى إلى فراشه: "الحمد لله الذي أطعمنا وسقانا وكفانا وآوانا، فكم ممن لا كافي له ولا مؤوي" [مسلم والترمذي].
وكان ينام أول الليل، ويقوم آخره، وربما سهر أول الليل في مصالح المسلمين، وكانت عينه تنام، ولا ينام قلبه، وكان إذا نام لم يوقظوه حتى يكون هو الذي يستيقظ، وكان إذا نام بالليل، اضطجع على جنبه الأيمن، وإذا نام قبيل الصبح نصب ذراعه، ووضع رأسه على كفه.[الترمذي].
ركوبه:
كان ( يركب الخيل والإبل والبغال والحمير، وكان يركب وحده، وربما أردف غيره خلفه على البعير، وكان أكثر ما يركب الخيل والإبل، ولم يكن عنده إلا بغلة واحدة، أهديت له.
بيعه وشراؤه :
كان ( يبيع ويشتري، وكان شراؤه أكثر من بيعه وخاصة بعد النبوة، ولا يحفظ له بعد الهجرة بيع إلا نادرًا.
وآجر رسول الله ( واستأجر، وكان استئجاره أكثر من إيجاره، وإنما يحفظ عنه أنه أجر نفسه قبل النبوة في رعاية الغنم، وأجر نفسه من خديجة في سفره بمال إلى الشام.
وشارك ( غيره في التجارة، واستدان برهن وبغير رهن، واستعار من غيره أشياء، واشترى حالاً ومؤجلاً.
معاملته:
كان ( أحسن الناس معاملة للناس، فكان إذا تسلف شيئا قضى خيرًا منه، فقد جاءه رجل يتقاضاه بعيراً، فقال رسول الله (: "أعطوه". فقالوا: لا نجد إلا سنًّا أفضل من سنِّه، فقال الرجل: أوفيتني أوفاك الله، فقال رسول الله (: "أعطوه، فإن من خيار الناس أحسنهم قضاء" [متفق عليه]، وكان إذا قضى ما استلفه دعا لمن سلفه، فقال:"بارك الله لك في أهلك ومالك، إنما جزاء السلف الحمد والأداء" [أحمد والنسائي وابن ماجة].
وكان سمحًا لمن تقاضاه، فقد جاءه رجل يتقاضاه، وأغلظ له القول، فهمَّ عمر بن الخطاب أن يضربه، فقال رسول الله (: "مه يا عمر كنت أحوج إلى أن تأمرني بالوفاء، وكان أحوج إلى أن تأمره بالصبر" [الحاكم].
أمور فطرته :
كان ( يعجبه التيامن في كل شيء في ترجله وطهوره وأخذه وعطائه، وكان يجعل اليمين لطعامه وشرابه وطهوره، ويساره لخلائه، وغير ذلك من إزالة الأذى.
الحلق: وكان يحب أن يحلق الرأس كله، أو يترك كله، وكان يكره أن يحلق بعضه، ويترك بعضه.
السواك: وكان يحب السواك، وكان يستاك مفطرًا وصائمًا، وكان يستعمل السواك في أحيان كثيرة، فكان يستاك عند النوم، وعند الوضوء، وعند الصلاة، وعند دخول المنزل، وكان يستاك بعود الأراك.
الطيب: وكان ( يحب الطيب ويكثر منه، وكان ( لا يردُّ الطيب، فقد ورد عنه قوله (: "من عرض عليه طيب فلا يرده" [مسلم].
وكان ( يكتحل، وكان ( يختضب، وقد سئل جابر بن سمرة -رضي الله عنه- أكان في رأس النبي ( شيب؟ قال: لم يكن في رأسه شيب إلا شعرات في مفرق رأسه إذا ادهن واراهُنَّ الدهن، وكان يسرح شعره ويزينه أحيانًا، وتزينه وتسرحه عائشة -رضي الله عنها- أحيانًا أخرى.
قص الشارب: كان رسول الله ( يقص شاربه، فعن زيد بن أرقم قال: قال رسول الله (: "من لم يأخذ من شاربه، فليس منَّا" [النسائي والترمذي].
وقد جعل الرسول ( وقتًا لا يترك بعده قص الشارب، فعن أنس قال: وقت لنا النبي ( في قص الشارب وتقليم الأظفار، ألا نترك أكثر من أربعين يومًا وليلة". [مسلم والترمذي والنسائي]
ضحكه وبكاؤه (:
كان ضحك النبي ( تبسمًا لا قهقهة، وكان يضحك مما يضحك منه الناس، ويضحك مما يتعجب من مثله، ويستغرب وقوعه، أو يكون شيئًا نادرًا الوقوع.
وأما بكاؤه فكان حاله كحال الضحك، لا يرفع فيه صوتًا، ولكن كانت عيناه تدمع، ويسمع لصدره أزيز، وكان بكاؤه تارة رحمة للميت، وتارة خوفًا من الله، وتارة خوفًا وشفقة على أمته، وكان يبكي عند سماع القرآن، وبكى عند وفاة ابنه إبراهيم، فلما سئل عن ذلك، قال (: "تدمع العين، ويحزن القلب، ولا نقول إلا ما يرضي ربنا، وإنا بك يا إبراهيم لمحزونون" [متفق عليه].
خطبته:
خطب الرسول ( على الأرض، وعلى المنبر، وعلى البعير، وعلى الناقة، وكان له جذع نخلة يخطب عليه حتى صنع له منبر، وكان إذا خطب احمرت عيناه، وعلا صوته، كأنه منذر جيش.
وكان إذا صعد المنبر أقبل على الناس بوجهه وقال: "السلام عليكم" وكان يختم خطبته بالاستغفار، وكثيرًا ما كان يخطب بالقرآن، فعن أم هشام بنت حارثة، قالت:" ما أخذت (ق والقرآن المجيد) إلا عن لسان رسول الله ( يقرؤها كل يوم جمعة على المنبر إذا خطب الناس" [مسلم والنسائي وأبو داود].
وكان ( يراعي حالة المخاطبين ومصلحتهم، وكان يفتتح خطبته بالحمد والثناء، ويتشهد فيها بالشهادة، ويذكر فيها نفسه باسمه "محمد" (، وكان إذا قام يخطب أخذ عصا، فتوكأ عليها وهو على المنبر وكان منبره ثلاث درجات فإذا استوى عليه، واستقبل الناس، أذن المؤذن ولم يقل شيئًا قبله ولا بعده، ولا يتكلم أحد أثناء خطبته.
وكان إذا عرض له في خطبته شيء عارض، اشتغل به، ثم رجع إلى خطبته، فقد كان يخطب ذات مرة الناس، فجاء الحسن والحسين يعثران في قميصين أحمرين. فقطع كلامه، فنزل، فحملهما، ثم عاد إلى منبره.
وكان خطبته قد تطول أو تقصر بحسب حاجة الناس، ومراعاة أحوالهم، وكانت خطبته العارضة أطول من خطبته الراتبة.
لبسه:
لم يتقيد الرسول ( بلبس نوع معين من الثياب، فقد كان يلبس ما تيسر له من اللباس، سواء أكان من الصوف أو القطن أو الكتان، وقد لبس الرسول ( البرود اليمانية، والبرد الأخضر، ولبس الجبة، والقباء، والقميص، والسراويل، والرداء، والخف، وأرخى الذؤابة من خلفه تارة، وتركها تارة.
وكان من هديه ( إذا لبس ثوبًا جديدًا أن يقول: "اللهمَّ أنت كسوتني هذا القميص أو الرداء أو العمامة، أسألك خيره وخير ما صنع له، وأعوذ بك من شره، وشر ما صنع له" [أبو داود والترمذي وأحمد].
مزاحه :
اشتهر عن الرسول ( أنه كان يمازح أزواجه، ويمازح أصحابه، وكثيرًا ما كان يمازح الأطفال والصبيان، فقد روى أنس أن رسول الله ( أتى لرجل من أصحابه كان يبيع متاعه في السوق، فاحتضنه رسول الله (، ولا يبصره الرجل، فقال الرجل: أرسلني، من هذا؟ فالتفت، فعرف رسول الله (، فجعل لا يألو ما ألصق ظهره لصدر الرسول ( حين عرفه، وجعل الرسول ( يقول: "من يشتري العبد؟" فقال: يا رسول الله، إذن والله تجدني كاسدًا، فقال (:"ولكن عند الله لست بكاسد، أو قال: ولكن أنت عند الله تعالى غالب" [أحمد]. وكثيراً ما كان الرسول ( يمازح الحسن والحسين -رضي الله عنهما-، ويحملهما على ظهره.
خلقه:
كان رسول الله ( أحسن الناس خلقًا، فكان كما قال الله له: (وإنك لعلى خلق عظيم) [القلم: 4]، وقد سئلت السيدة عائشة -رضي الله عنه- عن خلق رسول الله ( فقالت: كان أحسن الناس خلقًا، كان خلقه القرآن، يرضى لرضاه، ويغضب لغضبه، لم يكن فاحشًا ولا متفحشًا، ولا سخابًا في الأسواق، ولا يجزئ بالسيئة السيئة، ولكن يعفو ويصفح، ثم قالت: اقرأ سورة المؤمنين، اقرأ (قد أفلح المؤمنون) إلى العشر، فقرأ السائل قد أفلح المؤمنون، فقالت: هكذا كان خلق رسول الله (. [مسلم والترمذي]، بل جعل رسول الله ( غاية الرسالة إتمام الأخلاق الحميدة: فعن أبي هريرة -رضي الله عنه- قال: قال رسول الله (: "إنما جئت لأتمم صالح الأخلاق" [أحمد].
وكان ( لين المعاملة حتى مع خدمه، وكان متباسطًا، فقد كانت الأمة لتأخذ بيد رسول الله (، فما ينزع يده من يدها حتى تذهب حيث شاءت، ويجيب إذا دعا. [البخاري وأحمد]
وكان ( أحسن الناس تعليمًا، وأرفق الناس عند نصح أو تعليم الغير. وكان ( يخاطب الناس على قدر عقولهم.
حلمه وعفوه (:
كان ( أكثر الناس حلمًا، وقد قال له ربه -عز وجل-: (خذ العفو وأمر بالعرف وأعرض عن الجاهلين) [الأعراف: 199].
ولما نزلت هذه الآية، سأل الرسول ( جبريل عنها، فقال: لا أدري فصعد ثم نزل، فقال: يا محمد، إن الله تبارك وتعالى أمرك أن تعفو عمن ظلمك، وتعطي من حرمك، وتصل من قطعك" [ابن مردويه]. لذلك عفا ( عن أهل مكة عندما فتحها، على الرغم مما فعلوه معه. وحلم الرسول ( كان فيما يتعلق بحق نفسه (، أما إذا كان الحق لله، فإنما كان يتعامل بالشدة؛ لقول الله له: (يا أيها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم) [التحريم: 9].
حياؤه (:
اشتهر رسول الله ( بالحياء، حتى كان الصحابة يعرفون ذلك في وجهه، فعن أبي سعيد الخدري قال: كان رسول الله ( أشد حياء من العذراء في خدرها، وكان إذا كره شيئًا عرفناه في وجهه. [متفق عليه] وكان من حيائه ( أنه لا يسأل من شيء إلا أعطى. [عبد بن حميد].
رحمته وشفقته (:
وصف الله رسوله ( بالرحمة، فقال تعالى: (وما أرسلناك إلا رحمة للعالمين) [الأنبياء: 107]، ومن رحمته ( أنه كان كثير الدعاء لأمته. وعرف عنه ( رحمته بالصغار، وكان يخفف صلاته بالناس إذا سمع بكاء طفل رحمة بأمه.
وعرف عنه ( الرحمة والشفقة بالنساء، وأوصى بهن خيرًا.
تواضعه (:
أمر الله تعالى رسوله ( بالتواضع، فقال له: (واخفض جناحك لمن اتبعك من المؤمنين) [الشعراء: 215].
وقد اشتهر عنه ( التواضع، فكان ( يركب الحمار، ويلبس الصوف، ويعقل الشاة، ويجيب الضعيف والمسكين إلى الطعام [الحاكم]. ومن تواضعه ( أنه كان ينقل التراب يوم الأحزاب، وقد وارى التراب بياض إبطه. [البخاري].
وكان ( إذا سار مع أصحابه لا يسير أمامهم، بل يسير وسطهم أو خلفهم. [أحمد]، وكان ( لا يرد دعوة إنسان، بل كان يقول (: "لو دعيت إلى كراع لأجبت" [الخطيب]. وكان ( لا تغلق دونه لأبواب، ولا يقوم دونه الحجاب، فكان يقوم لكل من أراده، ويقضي حاجة من يطلب منه المساعدة.
وكان من تواضعه ( أنه كان يمر على الصبيان، فيسلم عليهم. ولما دخل ( مكة منتصرًا، دخلها وهو راكب دابته، وذقنه على رحله متخشعًا. [الحاكم]. وكان رسول الله ( إذا استقبله الرجل وصافحه، لا ينـزع يده عن يده، حتى يكون الرجل هو الذي ينـزع، ولا يصرف وجهه عن وجهه، حتى يكون الرجل هو الذي يصرفه، ولم ير مقدمًا ركبتيه بين يدي جليس له.
[الترمذي وابن ماجة].
وكان من تواضعه ( أنه لا يحب الثناء الكثير عليه، ولا يحب أن يقوم إليه أحد.
شجاعته (:
فزع أهل المدينة ذات ليلة، فانطلق الناس نحو الصوت، فتلقاهم رسول الله( راجعًا، وقد سبقهم إلى الصوت، وهو على فرس لأبي طلحة عرى، في عنقه السيف، وهو يقول:" لم تراعوا، لم تراعوا، ما وجدت من شيء" [ابن سعد].
وكان الرسول ( أشجع ما يكون في الحرب والقتال، فكان يثبت إذا فرَّ الناس، وقد كان الصحابة يعرفون شجاعة النبي(، بل كانوا يحتمون به وقت الشدة.
كرمه وجوده (:
اشتهر رسول الله ( بالجود والكرم، وما سئل(، فقال لا. [متفق عليه]
وقد امتدح الشاعر الفرزدق النبي ( في كرمه وجوده فقال:
ما قال لا قطُّ إلا في تشهُّده لولا التشهد كانت لاؤه نعمُ
وعن أنس -رضي الله عنه- قال: ما سئل رسول الله( شيئًا إلا أعطاه، ولقد جاءه رجل فأعطاه غنمًا بين جبلين، فرجع إلى أهله، فقال: يا قوم، أسلموا، فإن محمدًا يعطي عطاء من لا يخشى الفاقة، وإن كان الرجل ليجئ إلى الرسول وما يريد بذلك إلا الدنيا، فما يمسي حتى يكون دينه أحب إليه من الدنيا وما فيها. [مسلم].
خوفه وخشيته (:
كان رسول الله( شديد الخشية لله، تقول عائشة -رضي الله عنها-: ما رأيت رسول الله ( مستجمعًا قط ضاحكًا، حتى ترى لهواته، إنما كان يتبسم.
وعن أبي ذر -رضي الله عنه- قال: قرأ رسول الله ( سورة الإنسان (هل أتى) حتى ختمها، ثم قال: "إني أرى ما لا ترون، وأسمع ما لا تسمعون، أطّت السماء، وحقَّ لها أن تئط، ما فيها موضع أربع أصابع إلا وملك واضع جبهته ساجدًا لله، لو تعلمون ما أعلم، لضحكتم قليلاً، ولبكيتم كثيرًا، وما تلذذتم، بالنساء على الفرش، ولخرجتم إلى الصعدات تجأرون إلى الله تعالى، والله إني لوددت أني شجرة تعضد" [الحاكم].
شمائله (:
كان لرسول الله ( بعض المعجزات والبركات، منها تكثير الماء بين يديه (، فقد أوتي ( بإناء فيه ماء، فوضع فيه يده، وجاء الصحابة فتوضئوا منه، وكانوا أكثر من ثلاثمائة، ومنها تكثير اللبن في الإناء كما حدث مع أبي هريرة -رضي الله عنه- وأهل الصُفَّة، وكم من مرة وضع يده على شاة لا تحلب فحلبت، وسيرته في تكثير الماء والطعام من أن تحصى، بل كان الطعام والشراب يسبحان بين يديه (، وقد سمع الصحابة التسبيح.
ولما اتخذ الرسول ( منبرًا، وترك جذع النخلة الذي كان يخطب عليه، حنَّ الجذع إليه، وصاح صياح الصبي حتى تصدع وانشق، فاحتضنه الرسول (.
[أحمد والترمذي].
وقد سبح الحصى في يديه، فسمع الصحابة له صوتا كصوت النحل، ثم وضعه في كف أبي بكر فسبح، ثم في كف عمر، ثم في كف عثمان، فسبح. [الطبراني والبيهقي].
وقد وقف الرسول ( ومعه العشرة المبشرون بالجنة على جبل حراء، ففرح الجبل، فأمره الرسول ( أن يثبت ويهدأ. [البخاري].
ولما دخل الرسول ( مكة عند فتحها، وكان حول الكعبة ثلاثمائة وستون صنمًا، فأشار إلى كل صنع بعصا، وقال: (جاء الحق وزهق الباطل إن الباطل كان زهوقا) [الإسراء: 81]، فكان كل صنم يسقط دون أن يلمسه الرسول ( بالعصا. [متفق عليه]
وكان للنبي ( معجزات مع الحيوانات، فقد هاج جمل عند حائط من حوائط بني النجار، لا يستطيع أحد أن يمسكه، فجاء النبي (، ونادى الجمل، فأتى إلى الرسول ( وبرك بين يديه. [مسلم]
وجاءه ( جمل، قد جرح، وذرفت عيناه، فمسح رسول الله ( من رأسه إلى سنامه، فسكن الجمل، ثم قال لصاحبه: "أما تتقي الله في هذه البهيمة التي ملكتها، إنه شكا إلى أنك تجيعه وتدئبه" [أحمد ومسلم].
واشتكى علي بن أبي طالب إلى الرسول ( وجع عينيه، وكان الرسول ( قد أراد أن يعطيه راية خيبر، فبصق رسول الله ( في عينيه، ودعا له، فشفي حتى كأن لم يكن به مرض. [متفق عليه]
خصائصه (:
وقد اختص الله رسوله ( بكثير من الخصائص، أهمها: أن الله قد أخذ الميثاق على النبيين أن يؤمنوا به وينصروه ويبشروا به أممهم، وقد جاء وصف الرسول ( في الكتب السابقة، كما وصف أصحابه أيضا، كما أن الملائكة أظلته في سفره (، وأنه ( أرجع الناس عقلاً، وأنه رأى جبريل -عليه السلام- مرتين.
وخصه بأنه خاتم الأنبياء، وسيد الناس، وأكرم الخلق، وأنه بعث للناس كافة، وأن الجن آمنت به وأنه أرسل رحمة للعالمين، وأن شرعه مؤبد غير منسوخ، وأنه ناسخ لما قبله من الشرائع، وأنه نصر بالرعب مسيرة شهر، وأنه من صلى عليه مرة، صلى الله عليه به عشرا، وأن صلاة أمته تبلغه هو في قبره، وأنه أوتي جوامع الكلم، وجمع الله له القبلتين، وغفر له ما تقدم من ذنبه وما تأخر، وشرح له صدره، ووضع عنه وزره، ورفع له ذكره.
وخصه الله دون الأنبياء بأشياء أهمها: إحلال الغنائم له، والأرض كله مسجد، والتراب طهور، وغير ذلك من الخصائص التي لا تعد ولا تحصى، مما اختص الله سبحانه وتعالى به نبيه .
number-en: A gift, its characteristics and its merits
label-en:
The Prophet had wives, chosen by God - Glory be to Him - to be the mothers of the believers, and to carry the burden of calling with the Messenger (they are: Khadija bint Khuwaylid - may God be pleased with her - and she was the first wife of the Prophet), and he did not marry anyone else until she died.
And Sawda bint Zam’ah - may God be pleased with her - and the Messenger married her (after Khadija. Then he married Aisha bint Abu Bakr - may God be pleased with her - then he married Zainab bint Khuzaymah - may God be pleased with her - and she died with him). Then he married Umm Salamah Hind bint Abi Umayyah, who was the last of his women to die.
Then he married Zainab bint Jahsh, the daughter of his paternal aunt, who was the wife of Zaid bin Haritha, the servant of the Messenger of God (and God - Glory be to Him - was her guardian who married her to the Messenger of God, and she died at the beginning of the caliphate of Omar. He married Juwayriyah bint Al-Harith, then he married Umm Habiba Ramla bint Abi Sufyan, whom the Messenger had married (while she was in the country of Abyssinia). Al-Najashi paid her dowry, which amounted to four hundred dinars, and she died in the days of her brother. Muawiya.
He married Safiyya bint Huyay bin Akhtab, Sayyid Bani al-Nadir, then he married Maymunah bint al-Harith al-Hilalia, and she was the last one he married. Secrets:
Among his concubines were Maria the Copt, Rayhana, a maid whom Zainab bint Jahsh gave him, and another maid whom he had taken captive.
His children:
He had (children) Al-Qasim, Zainab, Abdullah, Ibrahim, Ruqayyah, Umm Kulthum, and Fatima, and all of his children were from Khadija - may God be pleased with her - except Ibrahim, as he was from Mariah Al-Qibtiyyah.
Characteristics of the Prophet:
The Messenger of God (may God bless him and grant him peace) was stately and stately, his face shone like the shine of the moon on a full moon night. He was neither tall nor short, with a large head. His hair was a man between curly hair and long hair, with a little breakage and abundant hair, extending to the lobes of his ears. He has a wide forehead, has a light above him, thick beard, very dark eyes, plain cheeks, and fine teeth, with holes between his teeth, broad chest, wide between the shoulders, large bone heads, hairy arms, shoulders, and upper chest, spacious at ease, smooth feet, with no cracks or cracks in them, quick to walk when he walks, as if he is descending from a cliff, and when he turns, he turns around completely. Area:
He was always in thought, had no rest, did not speak without need, was silent for a long time, spoke in many words, glorified blessings even if they were small, did not criticize or praise anything from her, did not get angry with himself, and did not support her. When he pointed, he pointed with his whole hand, and when her heart was amazed, most of his laughter was smiling.
His entry:
It was (if he entered his house, he divided his entry into three parts: a part for God, a part for his family, and a part for himself, then he divided his part between himself and the people, and he distributed that to the public and the private, and did not enter anything on their behalf. His council:
He would not sit or stand except in remembrance of God Almighty. He would sit wherever the assembly ended, give all of its sessions a share. He would not see anyone more generous than him in his assembly. He would not leave whoever was with him. Whoever asked him for a need would only respond with it. If he did not find it, then with a good word. All people in his assembly were the same. His assembly was a gathering of forbearance, modesty, patience, and honesty, in which voices were not raised, and in which faults were not mentioned. He is harsh, does not talk, is not obscene, does not criticize, and does not joke a lot. He ignores what he does not desire. In his gatherings, people would abstain from three things: that he should not disparage anyone, that he should not criticize anyone, that he should not ask for someone’s faults, that he should not speak except about what he hoped would be rewarded, that he should laugh when those present laughed and be surprised at what they were surprised about, that he should be patient with a stranger for his harshness in his words and questions, and that he would not interrupt his conversation with anyone.
His silence:
His silence was based on four things: forbearance, caution, appreciation, and contemplation. As for his discretion, it was his level of looking and listening among people, and as for his contemplation, it was about what remains and what will perish. It was combined for “forbearance and patience,” so nothing made him angry unless God’s prohibitions were violated. His food:
He did not return the food he found, and he did not bother to ask for what he lost, so he ate whatever came near to him, and if his soul felt good, he did not blame it and left it. He used to eat whatever he could, but if he did not find anything to eat, he would be patient. Out of hunger, he would place a stone on his stomach. One crescent moon would pass by another crescent moon, and he would not light a fire in his house. The earth was his table, and he would place his food on it. He would eat with three fingers, which was the noblest thing to do in eating. The arrogant one eats with one finger, and the greedy eats with five. He would not eat while reclining, and he used to call God Almighty at the beginning of the food and praise Him at the end, and he would say: “Praise be to God, good and blessed praise, in which there is no sufficiency, no tears, and no one can do without Him.” [Al-Bukhari]
Drink it:
He used to name God before drinking, and praise Him after, and he drank most of the time while sitting. Rather, he forbade drinking while standing, and once he drank while standing, to make it clear that it is permissible for you if it was due to a need or an excuse. And when he drank, he would give something to the person on his right, even if the person on his left was older than him, because he (likes to take the right hand in everything. His sleep:
He used to sleep on the bed sometimes, on mats sometimes, on the floor, and on the bed sometimes. On the authority of Abbad bin Tamim, on the authority of his uncle, he said: I saw the Messenger of God lying in the mosque, placing one of his legs on the other. [Agreed upon]. His bed was made of leather that had been stuffed with fibre. When he wanted to sleep, he would bring his palms together and blow on them, then recite in them: (Say: He is God, One) and (Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of creation) and (Say: I seek refuge in the Lord.) People) Then he wipes with them as much of his body as he can, starting with them on his head, face, and the rest of his body. He does this three times. [Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi]. He used to sleep on his right side, placing his right hand under his cheek, then saying: “Oh God, protect me from your torment on the day You resurrect your servants” [Abu Dawud and al-Tirmidhi], and when he went to bed, he would say: “Praise be to God who fed us and gave us drink, and sufficed us and sheltered us. How many there are who have no sufficiency or shelter” [Muslim and al-Tirmidhi].
He used to sleep at the beginning of the night, and get up at the end of it, and he might stay up at the beginning of the night in the interests of the Muslims, and his eyes would sleep, but his heart would not sleep, and when he slept, they would not wake him until he was the one who woke up, and when he slept at night, he would lie on his right side, and if he slept before dawn, he would raise his arm, and put his head on his palm. [Al-Tirmidhi]. Ride it:
He used to ride horses, camels, mules, and donkeys. He used to ride alone, and sometimes someone else would ride the camel behind him. He mostly rode horses and camels, and he only had one mule, which was given to him as a gift.
Buy and sell it:
He used to buy and sell, and his buying was more than his selling, especially after his prophethood. After the Hijra, no selling was recorded except rarely.
The Messenger of God was rewarded (and he was hired, and his hire was more than his rent, but it is preserved from him that he rented himself before the Prophethood for tending sheep, and rented himself from Khadija when he traveled with money to the Levant. He participated (with others) in trade, borrowed with or without a mortgage, borrowed things from others, and bought immediate and deferred purchases.
His treatment:
He was the best of people in treating people. Whenever he borrowed something, he would pay something better than it. A man came to him and would pay him a camel, and the Messenger of God said, “Give him.” They said, “We only find a tooth better than his.” The man said, “You have paid me back, may God pay you back.” The Messenger of God said, “Give him, for among the best of people is the best in spending.” [Agreed upon]. And when he spent what he borrowed, he would supplicate for whomever he borrowed, and he said: “May God bless your family and your wealth. The reward of the predecessors is praise and performance.” [Ahmad, Al-Nasa’i and Ibn Majah]. He was tolerant of those who paid him. A man came to him to pay him, and he spoke harshly to him. Omar ibn al-Khattab decided to beat him, so the Messenger of God said, “Mh, O Omar, I needed you to command me to pay, and I was more in need of you to command him to be patient.” [Al-Hakim].
Natural matters:
He liked to take the right hand in everything, in his sitting, purification, taking, and giving. He used to make the right hand for his food, drink, and purification, and his left hand for his privacy, and other things to remove harm.
Shaving: He liked to shave the entire head, or leave it all, and he hated to shave part of it and leave part of it. The siwak: He loved the siwak, and used it when breaking his fast and while fasting. He used the siwak many times. He used the siwak when sleeping, when performing ablution, when praying, and when entering the house. He used the siwak to use the siwak.
Good: He (loved good and used it in abundance), and he (did not reject good), as it was reported from him that he said (: “Whoever is offered good, do not turn it back” [Muslim]. He used kohl, and he used dye, and Jabir bin Samra - may God be pleased with him - was asked: Did the Prophet (may God be pleased with him) have gray hair? He said: There was no gray hair on his head except for hairs at the parting of his head when he applied oil and applied oil. He used to style his hair and decorate it sometimes, and Aisha - may God be pleased with her - decorated it and combed it at other times.
Trimming the mustache: The Messenger of God used to trim his mustache. On the authority of Zaid bin Arqam, he said: The Messenger of God said: “Whoever does not trim his mustache is not one of us” [Al-Nasa’i and Al-Tirmidhi]. The Messenger established (a time after which he should not omit trimming the moustache. On the authority of Anas he said: A time for us the Prophet (in trimming the mustache and trimming the nails, not to omit more than forty days and nights).) [Muslim, Al-Tirmidhi and Al-Nasa’i]
Laughing and crying (:
The Prophet’s laughter was a smile, not a guffaw, and he used to laugh at what people laughed at, and he laughed at something similar to which he was surprised to see, or was surprised that it happened, or was something that rarely happened. As for his crying, his condition was like that of laughter, in which he did not raise a sound, but his eyes were tearing up, and he could hear his chest wheezing, and his crying was sometimes out of mercy for the dead, sometimes out of fear of God, and sometimes out of fear and pity for his nation. He used to cry when hearing the Qur’an, and he cried when his son Abraham died. When he was asked about that, he said: “The eyes bring tears, and the heart grieves, and we say only what pleases our Lord, and indeed, with you, O Abraham, we are sad.” [Agreed upon]. His engagement:
The Messenger preached (on the ground, on the pulpit, on a camel, and on a she-camel. He had a palm tree trunk on which he preached until a pulpit was made for him. When he preached, his eyes would turn red and his voice would rise, as if he were warning an army.
Whenever he ascended the pulpit, he would face the people and say: “Peace be upon you.” He would conclude his sermon by asking for forgiveness, and he would often deliver a sermon with the Qur’an. On the authority of Umm Hisham bint Haritha, she said: “I did not take (Q and the Glorious Qur’an) except from the tongue of the Messenger of God (he recites it every Friday on the pulpit when he addresses the people” [Muslim, Al-Nasa’i and Abu Dawud]. He was (taking into account the condition and interests of the addressees, and he would begin his sermon with praise and praise, bearing witness in it to the Shahada, and mentioning himself in it by his name, “Muhammad.”) And when he stood up to deliver the sermon, he would take a stick and lean on it while he was on the pulpit, and his pulpit had three steps. When he stood on it and faced the people, the muezzin would call the muezzin and would not say anything before or after it, and no one would speak during his sermon.
Whenever something incidental came to him during his sermon, he would focus on it, then return to his sermon. One time he was addressing people, and Al-Hassan and Al-Hussein came stumbling wearing red shirts. He interrupted his speech, went down, carried them, and then returned to his pulpit.
His sermon could be long or short according to the needs of the people and taking into consideration their circumstances, and his occasional sermon was longer than his regular sermon.
Wear it:
The Messenger did not adhere to wearing a specific type of clothing. He used to wear whatever clothing was available to him, whether it was wool, cotton, or linen. The Messenger wore the Yemeni cloak, the green cloak, the robe, the cloak, the shirt, the trousers, the robe, and the slippers. He sometimes let down the coat behind him, and sometimes left it on. One of his guidance was (when he put on a new garment, he would say: “O God, you clothed me with this shirt, robe, or turban. I ask You for its goodness and the goodness of what was done to it, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil of what was done to it.”) [Abu Dawud, Al-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad].
Joking:
It is well known about the Messenger (that he used to joke with his wives, and with his companions, and he often joked with children and boys. Anas narrated that the Messenger of God (came to a man of his companions who was selling his goods in the market, so the Messenger of God embraced him) and the man did not see him, so the man said: Send me, who is this? So he turned around, and he recognized the Messenger of God (and began not to care about what stuck his back to the Messenger’s chest) when he recognized him, and the Messenger (said: “Who buys the slave?” Then he said: O Messenger of God, then by God you find me a tyrant. He said: “But with God I am not a tyrant,” or he said: “But in the sight of God Almighty you are victorious” [Ahmed]. The Messenger (often used to joke with Al-Hasan and Al-Hussein - may God be pleased with them) and carry them on his back. His character:
The Messenger of God (was the best of people in character, so he was as God said to him: (And indeed, you are of great character) [Al-Qalam: 4]. Lady Aisha - may God be pleased with her) was asked about the character of the Messenger of God (and she said: He was the best of people. His character was the Qur’an. He was pleased with His pleasure and angered when He was angry. He was not obscene or indecent, nor did he gossip in the markets. He did not repay evil with evil, but he pardoned and pardoned. Then She said: Read Surah Al-Mu'minun, read (The Believers have succeeded) up to ten, so the questioner recited, 'The Believers have succeeded', and she said: This is how the Messenger of God was created (. [Muslim and Al-Tirmidhi], Rather, the Messenger of God made (the goal of the message to be the completion of good morals): On the authority of Abu Hurairah - may God be pleased with him - he said: The Messenger of God said (: “I have only come to complete good morals” [Ahmad].
He was gentle in his dealings, even with his servants, and he was easy-going. The female slave would have taken the hand of the Messenger of God. He would not remove his hand from hers until she went wherever she wanted, and he would answer when he called. [Al-Bukhari and Ahmad]
He was the most well-educated of people, and the most gentle when advising or teaching others. He used to address people according to their intellect.
His dream and forgiveness (:
He was (the most forbearing of people, and his Lord - the Almighty - said to him: (Embrace forgiveness, enjoin what is right, and turn away from the ignorant) [Al-A’raf: 199].
When this verse was revealed, the Messenger (Gabriel) asked about it, and he said: I do not know. So he went up and then came down and said: O Muhammad, God, Blessed and Most High, commanded you to pardon those who wronged you, give to those who deprived you, and maintain ties with those who separated from you” [Ibn Mardawayh]. Therefore, he pardoned the people of Mecca when he conquered it, despite what they did to him. The Messenger’s dream (was in relation to his own rights), but if the truth belongs to God, then he was dealing with severity, because God said to him: (O Prophet, strive hard against the disbelievers and hypocrites and be harsh with them) [Al-Tahrim: 9].
His modesty (:
The Messenger of God (was famous for his shyness, even the Companions knew that in his face. On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, he said: The Messenger of God (was more shy than a virgin in her shyness, and if he disliked something we recognized it in his face. [Agreed upon] and part of his modesty) was that he did not ask for anything without giving. [Abdullah bin Hamid].
His mercy and compassion (:
God described His Messenger (with mercy, and God Almighty said: (And We have not sent you except as a mercy to the worlds)) [Al-Anbiya’: 107], and from his mercy (is that he used to supplicate a lot for his nation. He was known for his mercy toward children, and he would shorten his prayers with people if he heard a child crying out of mercy for his mother.
He was known for his mercy and compassion towards women, and he advised them well.
His humility (:
God Almighty commanded His Messenger (to be humble), and said to him: (And lower your wings to those of the believers who follow you) [Al-Shu’ara’: 215]. He was famous for his humility, as he used to ride a donkey, wear wool, groom a sheep, and provide food to the weak and needy [Al-Hakim]. Among his humility is that he used to move dirt on the Day of the Battles, and the dirt covered the whites of his armpits. [Al-Bukhari].
“When he walked with his companions, he would not walk in front of them, but rather he would walk in the middle or behind them. [Ahmad], and he (would not refuse someone’s invitation. Rather, he would say: ‘If I had been invited to a village, I would have responded’) [Al-Khatib]. (No doors were closed without him, and no veil stood before him.) So he would stand for everyone who wanted him, and fulfill the needs of those who asked him for help.
Part of his humility was that he used to pass by the boys and greet them. And when he entered Mecca in triumph, he entered it riding his animal, with his chin on his saddle bowed and humbled. [Al-Hakim]. The Messenger of God, when a man received him and shook hands with him, would not remove his hand from his, so that the man would be the one to remove it, and would not turn his face away from his face, so that the man would be the one turning him away. He did not see his knees in front of the hands of someone sitting with him.
[Al-Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah]. Part of his humility was that he did not like a lot of praise, and he did not like anyone to come up to him.
His courage (:
The people of Medina were terrified one night, so the people started towards the sound, and the Messenger of God (returning) met them, and he had preceded them to the sound, and he was riding on Abu Talha’s naked horse, with a sword around his neck, and he was saying: “You did not observe, you did not observe, I did not find anything” [Ibn Saad].
The Messenger (was the bravest in war and fighting, so he would stand firm when people fled, and the Companions knew the courage of the Prophet). Rather, they would take refuge in him in times of distress.
His generosity is his presence (:
The Messenger of God was famous for his generosity and generosity, and he was not asked about anything, so he said no. [Agreed upon]
The poet Al-Farazdaq praised the Prophet for his generosity and presence, saying:
He never said no except in his tashahhud. If it were not for the tashahhud, his no would have been yes
On the authority of Anas - may God be pleased with him - he said: The Messenger of God (may God be pleased with him) never asked for anything but he gave it to him. A man came to him and gave him sheep between two mountains. Then he returned to his family and said: O my people, embrace Islam, for Muhammad gives the gift of one who does not fear poverty. And if a man were to come to the Messenger and what he wanted by doing so was the world, then he would not come until his religion was dearer to him than the world and all that is in it. [Muslim].
His fear and apprehension (:
The Messenger of God (may God be pleased with him) had a great fear of God. Aisha - may God be pleased with her - said: I never saw the Messenger of God (may God bless him and grant him peace) laughing together, so much so that you could see his amusement. Rather, he was smiling.
On the authority of Abu Dharr - may God be pleased with him - he said: The Messenger of God recited (Surat Al-Insan (Has He Come)) until he finished it, then he said: “I see what you do not see, and I hear what you do not hear. The sky expanded, and it has the right to bow down, and there is no place in it for four fingers except for an angel with his forehead prostrated to God. If you knew what I know, you would laugh little, and weep a lot, and you would not take pleasure in women on beds, and you would go out to the ascents.” You dare to God Almighty, By God, I wish I were a tree that would support me.” [Al-Hakim].
Shamaila (:
The Messenger of God (had some miracles and blessings, including the multiplication of water in his hands). He was given (a vessel containing water, so he put his hand in it, and the Companions came and performed ablution from it, and they were more than three hundred. Among them was the multiplication of milk in the vessel, as happened with Abu Hurairah - may God be pleased with him - and the people of Suffah. How many times did he put his hand on a sheep that was not milked and it milked? His behavior in the abundance of water and food is too numerous to count. Rather, the food and drink were They glorified God in front of him, and the Companions heard the glorification. When the Messenger took (a pulpit, and left the trunk of the palm tree on which he was delivering the sermon, the trunk bent towards him, and the shout of a boy shouted until it cracked and split, so the Messenger embraced him ().
[Ahmad and Al-Tirmidhi].
The pebbles swam in his hands, and the Companions heard a sound like the sound of bees. Then he put them in the palm of Abu Bakr and he swam, then in the palm of Omar, then in the palm of Uthman, so he swam. [Al-Tabarani and Al-Bayhaqi].
The Messenger (and with him the ten who were promised Paradise) stood on Mount Hira, and the mountain rejoiced, so the Messenger commanded him (to remain steadfast and calm down). [Bukhari].
When the Messenger entered (Mecca at the time of its conquest, and there were three hundred and sixty idols around the Kaaba, he pointed to each item with a stick, and said: (Truth has come and falsehood has perished. Indeed, falsehood has perished) [Al-Isra: 81], so every idol fell without the Messenger touching it (with the stick). [Agreed upon]
The Prophet had miracles with animals. A camel ran rampant at one of the walls of Bani al-Najjar, and no one could restrain it. So the Prophet came and called the camel, and it came to the Messenger and blessed him in his hands. [Muslim]
A camel came to him, wounded and with tears in his eyes. So the Messenger of God wiped him from his head to his hump, and the camel calmed down. Then he said to its owner: “Are you not fearing God regarding this animal that you have owned? He complained to me that you were starving him and exhausting him” [Ahmad and Muslim].
Ali bin Abi Talib complained to the Messenger about the pain in his eyes, and the Messenger wanted to give him the banner of Khaybar, so the Messenger of God spat in his eyes and prayed for him, and he was healed as if he had no disease. [Agreed upon]
Its characteristics (:
God has singled out His Messenger (with many characteristics, the most important of which is that God took a covenant from the prophets to believe in Him, support Him, and give good tidings to their nations. The Messenger was described (in the previous books, as was also described by his companions, just as the angels shaded him on his travels), and that he (brought people back reason, and that he saw Gabriel - peace be upon him) twice. He singled him out as the seal of the prophets, the master of people, and the most honorable of creation, that he was sent to all people, that the jinn believed in him, that he was sent as a mercy to the worlds, that his law is eternal and not abrogated, that he abrogates the laws that came before it, that he was defeated by terror the distance of a month, that whoever prayed upon him once, God will bless him ten times, that the prayer of his nation will reach him in his grave, that he was given all the words, and God combined the two kisses for him, and forgave him his previous sins. His sin and what was delayed, and He opened his chest to him, and removed his burden from him, and raised his remembrance for him. God singled him out over the prophets with things, the most important of which are: spoils being made permissible for him, the entire earth being a place of worship, the dirt being pure, and countless other characteristics that God Almighty singled out for his Prophet.

كان العرب في شبه الجزيرة العربية قبل بعثة الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يعبدون الأصنام من دون الله، ويقدمون لها القرابين، ويسجدون لها، ويتوسلون بها، وهي أحجار لا تضر ولا تنفع، وكان حول الكعبة ثلاثمائة وستون صنمًا.
ومن عجيب أمرهم أن أحدهم كان يشتري العجوة، ويصنع منها صنمًا، ثم يعبده ويسجد له، ويسأله أن يحجب عنه الشر ويجلب له الخير، فإذا شعر بالجوع أكل إلهه!! ثم يأخذ كأسًا من الخمر، يشربها حتى يفقد وعيه، وفي ذلك الزمان كانت تحدث أشياء غريبة وعجيبة، فالناس يطوفون عرايا حول الكعبة، وقد تجردوا من ملابسهم بلا حياء، يصفقون ويصفرون ويصيحون بلا نظام، وقد وصف الله -عز وجل- صلاتهم فقال: {وما كان صلاتهم عند البيت إلا مكاء وتصدية فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون} [الأنفال:35].
وكانت الحروب تقوم بينهم لأتفه الأسباب، وتستمر مشتعلة أعوامًا طويلة فهذان رجلان يقتتلان، فيجتمع الناس حولهما، وتناصر كل قبيلة صاحبها، لم يسألوا عن الظالم ولا عن المظلوم، وتقوم الحرب في لمح البصر، ولا تنتهي حتى يموت الرجال، وانتشرت بينهم العادات السيئة مثل: شرب الخمر، وقطع
الطرق والزنا.
وكانت بعض القبائل تهين المرأة، وينظرون إليها باحتقار، فهي في اعتقادهم عار كبير عليهم أن يتخلصوا منها، فكان الرجل منهم إذا ولدت له أنثى؛ حزن حزنًا شديدًا. قال تعالى: {وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُمْ بِالأُنثَى ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُ مُسْوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ * يَتَوَارَى مِنَ الْقَوْمِ مِن سُوءِ مَا بُشِّرَ بِهِ أَيُمْسِكُهُ عَلَى هُونٍ أَمْ يَدُسُّهُ فِي التُّرَابِ أَلاَ سَاء مَا يَحْكُمُونَ} _[النحل: 58-59] وقد يصل به الأمر إلى أن يدفنها وهي حية، وهي العادة التي عرفت عندهم بوأد البنات.
فهذا رجل يحمل طفلته ويسير بها إلى الصحراء فوق الرمال المحرقة، ويحفر حفرة ثم يضع ابنته فيها وهي حية، ولا تستطيع الطفلة البريئة أن تدافع عن نفسها؛ بل تناديه: أبتاه .. أبتاه .. فلا يرحم براءتها ولا ضعفها، ولا يستجيب لندائها.. بل يهيل عليها الرمال، ثم يمشي رافعًا رأسه كأنه لم يفعل شيئًا!! قال تعالى: {وإذا الموءودة سئلت بأي ذنب قتلت} [التكوير: 7-8] وليس هذا الأمر عامًا بين العرب، فقد كانت بعض القبائل تمنع وأد البنات.
وكان الظلم ينتشر في المجتمع؛ فالقوى لا يرحم الضعيف، والغني لا يعطف على الفقير، بل يُسخره لخدمته، وإن أقرضه مالا؛ فإنه يقرضه بالربا، فإذا اقترض الفقير دينارًا؛ يرده دينارين، فيزداد فقرًا، ويزداد الغني ثراء، وكانت القبائل متفرقة، لكل قبيلة رئيس، وهم لا يخضعون لقانون منظم، ومع كل هذا الجهل والظلام في ذلك العصر المسمى بالعصر الجاهلي، كانت هناك بعض الصفات الطيبة
والنبيلة؛ كإكرام الضيف، فإذا جاء ضيف على أحدهم بذل له كل ما عنده، ولم يبخل عليه بشىء، فها هو ذا حاتم الطائي لم يجد ما يطعم به ضيوفه؛ فذبح
فرسه -وقد كانوا يأكلون لحم الخيل- وأطعمهم قبل أن يأكل هو.
وكانوا ينصرون المستغيث فإذا نادى إنسان، وقال: إني مظلوم اجتمعوا حوله وردوا إليه حقه، وقد حدث ذات مرة أن جاء رجل يستغيث، وينادي بأعلى صوته في زعماء قريش أن ينصروه على العاص بن وائل الذي اشترى منه بضاعته، ورفض أن يعطيه ثمنها؛ فتجمع زعماء قريش في دار عبدالله بن جدعان وتحالفوا على أن ينصروا المظلوم، ويأخذوا حقه من الظالم، وسموا ذلك الاتفاق حلف الفضول، وذهبوا إلى العاص بن وائل، وأخذوا منه ثمن البضاعة، وأعطوه لصاحبه.
وفي هذا المجتمع ولد محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم من أسرة كريمة المعدن، نبيلة النسب، جمعت ما في العرب من فضائل، قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم عن نفسه: (إن الله اصطفى كنانة من ولد إسماعيل، واصطفى قريشًا من كنانة واصطفي من قريش بني هاشم، واصطفاني من بني هاشم) [مسلم].
number-en: Conditions of the Arabs before Islam
label-en:
Before the mission of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, the Arabs in the Arabian Peninsula used to worship idols instead of God, and they offered sacrifices to them, prostrated to them, and pleaded with them. They were stones that did no harm or benefit. There were three hundred and sixty idols around the Kaaba.
One of the strangest things about them is that one of them used to buy ajwa, make an idol out of it, then worship it and prostrate to it, and ask it to protect him from evil and bring him good, and when he felt hungry, he ate his god!! Then he takes a cup of wine and drinks it until he loses consciousness. At that time, strange and wondrous things were happening. People would circumambulate naked around the Kaaba, stripped of their clothes without shame, clapping, whistling, and shouting without order. God Almighty described their prayer, saying: {And their prayer at the House was nothing but wailing and shouting. So taste the torment because you disbelieved} [Al-Anfal: 35].
Wars would break out between them for the most trivial of reasons, and would continue to rage for long years. These were two men fighting, and people would gather around them, and each tribe would support its owner. They would not ask about the oppressor or the oppressed. The war would break out in the blink of an eye, and would not end until the men died. Bad habits spread among them, such as: drinking alcohol and cutting off...
Roads and adultery.
Some tribes used to insult women and look at them with contempt. They believed that it was a great disgrace for them to get rid of them. If a man among them gave birth to a girl, He was very sad. God Almighty said: {And when the good tidings of a female is given to one of them, his face remains dark and he is gloomy. Humiliation or trample it in the dust? Is it not evil that they decide?
This is a man carrying his child and walking with her into the desert over the burning sand, digging a hole and then putting his daughter in it while she was alive, and the innocent child was unable to defend herself; Rather, she calls him: Father... Father... He does not have mercy on her innocence or her weakness, nor does he respond to her calls... Rather, he throws sand on her, then walks with his head raised as if he had not done anything!! God Almighty said: {And when the woman who is having sex is asked, for what sin was she killed?} [Al-Takwir: 7-8] This matter is not general among the Arabs, as some tribes prohibited the infanticide of girls.
Injustice was spreading in society; The strong do not have mercy on the weak, and the rich do not be kind to the poor, but rather force him to serve him, even if he lends him money. He lends it to him at interest, so if the poor person borrows a dinar; He returned two dinars, and he became poorer, and the rich became richer. The tribes were dispersed, each tribe had a chief, and they were not subject to an organized law. Despite all this ignorance and darkness in that era called the pre-Islamic era, there were some good qualities.
And noble; Like honoring a guest, if a guest comes to one of them, he gives him everything he has, and does not skimp on him with anything. Here, Hatem Al-Tai did not find anything to feed his guests. So he slaughtered
His horse - they ate horse meat - and he fed them before he ate.
They would help those seeking help, and if a person called out and said: I am wronged, they would gather around him and return his rights to him. It happened once that a man came asking for help, and calling at the top of his voice to the leaders of Quraysh to support him against Al-Aas bin Wael, from whom he had bought his goods, and refused to give him the price for them. So the leaders of Quraish gathered in the house of Abdullah bin Jadaan and agreed to support the oppressed and take his rights from the oppressor. They called that agreement the Alliance of Fudul. They went to Al-Aas bin Wael, took the price of the goods from him, and gave it to its owner.
In this society, Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was born from a noble family of noble lineage, which combined the virtues of the Arabs. The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said about himself: (God chose Kinana from the descendants of Ishmael, and chose Quraysh from Kinana, and chose from Quraysh Banu Hashim, and chose me from Banu Hashim) [Muslim].

number: نسب الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم
label:
هو محمد بن عبد الله بن عبد المطلب بن هاشم بن عبد مناف بن قصي بن كلاب بن مرة بن كعب بن لؤى بن غالب بن فهر بن مالك بن النضر بن كنانة بن خزيمة بن مدركة بن إلياس بن مضر بن نزار بن معد بن عدنان الذي يصل نسبه إلى إسماعيل بن إبراهيم -عليهما الصلاة والسلام..
جده هاشم وحكاية الثريد:
كان عمرو بن عبد مناف الجد الأكبر للرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم رجلا كريمًا فقد حدث في عصره أن نزل القحط بالناس، فلم يجدوا ما يأكلون، وكادوا يموتون جوعًا، وبدأ كل إنسان يفكر في نجاة نفسه فقط، فالذي عنده طعام يحرص عليه ويحجبه عن الناس، فذهب عمرو إلى بيته وأخرج ما عنده من الطعام، وأخذ يهشم الثريد (أي: يكسر الخبز في المرق) لقومه ويطعمهم، فسموه (هاشمًا)؛ لأنه كريم يهشم ثريده للناس جميعًا.
وعندما ضاق الرزق في مكة أراد هاشم أن يخفف عن أهلها، فسافر إلى الشام صيفًا، وإلى اليمن شتاء؛ من أجل التجارة، فكان أول من علَّم الناس هاتين الرحلتين، وفي إحدى الرحلات، وبينما هاشم في طريقه للشام مر بيثرب، فتزوج سلمى بنت عمرو إحدى نساء بني النجار، وتركها وهي حامل بابنه عبد المطلب لتلد بين أهلها الذين اشترطوا عليه ذلك عند زواجه منها.
جده عبدالمطلب وحكاية الكنز:
كان عبد المطلب بن هاشم جد الرسول الكريم صلى الله عليه وسلم يسقي الحجيج الذين يأتون للطواف حول الكعبة، ويقوم على رعاية بيت الله الحرام فالتف الناس حوله، فكان زعيمهم وأشرفهم، وكان عبدالمطلب يتمنى لو عرف مكان بئر زمزم ليحفرها؛ لأنها كانت قد ردمت بمرور السنين، ولم يَعُد أحد يعرف مكانها، فرأى في منامه ذات ليلة مكان بئر زمزم، فأخبر قومه بذلك ولكنهم لم يصدقوه، فبدأ عبدالمطلب في حفر البئر هو وابنه الحارث، والناس يسخرون منهما، وبينما هما يحفران، تفجر الماء من تحت أقدامهما، والتف الناس حول البئر مسرورين، وظن عبدالمطلب أنهم سيشكرونه، لكنه فوجئ بهم ينازعونه امتلاك البئر، فشعر بالظلم والضعف لأنه ليس له أبناء إلا الحارث، وهو لا يستطيع نصرته، فإذا به يرفع يديه إلى السماء، ويدعو الله أن يرزقه عشرة أبناء من الذكور، ونذر أن يذبح أحدهم تقربًا لله.
حكاية الأبناء العشرة :
استجاب الله دعوة عبد المطلب، فرزقه عشرة أولاد، وشعر عبدالمطلب بالفرحة فقد تحقق رجاؤه، ورزق بأولاد سيكونون له سندًا وعونًا، لكن فرحته لم تستمر طويلا؛ فقد تذكر النذر الذي قطعه على نفسه، فعليه أن يذبح واحدًا من
أولاده، فكر عبدالمطلب طويلا، ثم ترك الاختيار لله تعالى، فأجرى قرعة بين أولاده، فخرجت القرعة على عبدالله أصغر أولاده وأحبهم إلى قلبه، فأصبح
عبد المطلب في حيرة؛ أيذبح ولده الحبيب أم يعصى الله ولا يفي بنذره؟
فاستشار قومه، فأشاروا عليه بأن يعيد القرعة، فأعادها مرارًا، لكن القدر كان يختار عبدالله في كل مرة، فازداد قلق عبدالمطلب، فأشارت عليه كاهنة بأن يفتدي ولده بالإبل، فيجري القرعة بين عبدالله وعشرة من الإبل، ويظل يضاعف عددها، حتى تستقر القرعة على الإبل بدلا من ولده، فعمل عبدالمطلب بنصيحة الكاهنة، واستمر في مضاعفة عدد الإبل حتى بلغت مائة بعير، وعندئذ وقعت القرعة عليها، فذبحها فداء لعبد الله، وفرحت مكة كلها بنجاة عبد الله، وذبح له والده مائة ناقة فداءً له، وازداد عبد المطلب حبًّا لولده، وغمره بعطفه ورعايته.
أبوه عبدالله وزواجه المبارك من السيدة آمنة:
كان عبد الله أكرم شباب قريش أخلاقًا، وأجملهم منظرًا، وأراد والده
عبد المطلب أن يزوجه، فاختار له زوجة صالحة، هي السيدة آمنة بنت وهب بن عبد مناف بن زهرة أطهر نساء بني زهرة، وسيدة نسائهم، والسيدة آمنة تلتقي في نسبها مع عبدالله والد النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم في كلاب بن مرة، وتمر الأيام، ويخرج عبدالله في تجارة إلى الشام، بعد أن ترك زوجته آمنة حاملا ولحكمة يعلمها الله، مات عبد الله قبل أن يرى وليده.
حكاية الفيل:
وذات يوم، استيقظ أهل مكة على خبر أصابهم بالفزع والرعب، فقد جاء ملك اليمن أبرهة الأشرم الحبشي بجيش كبير، يتقدمه فيل ضخم، يريد هدم الكعبة حتى يتحول الحجيج إلى كنيسته التي بناها في اليمن، وأنفق عليها
أموالا كثيرة، واقترب الجيش من بيت الله الحرام، وظهر الخوف والهلع على وجوه أهل مكة، والتف الناس حول عبدالمطلب الذي قال لأبرهة بلسان الواثق من نصر الله تعالى: (للبيت رب يحميه).
فازداد أبرهة عنادًا، وأصرَّ على هدم الكعبة، فوجه الفيل الضخم نحوها، فلما اقترب منها أدار الفيل ظهره ولم يتحرك،، وأرسل الله طيورًا من السماء تحمل حجارة صغيرة، لكنها شديدة صلبة، ألقت بها فوق رءوس جنود أبرهة فقتلتهم وأهلكتهم. قال تعالى: {ألم تر كيف فعل ربك بأصحاب الفيل . ألم يجعل كيدهم في تضليل . وأرسل عليهم طيرًا أبابيل . ترميهم بحجارة من سجيل فجعلهم كعصف مأكول} [الفيل] وفي هذا العام ولد الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم.
number-en: Lineage of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace
label-en:
He is Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Abdul Muttalib bin Hashim bin Abd Manaf bin Qusayy bin Kilab bin Murra bin Kaab bin Luay bin Ghalib bin Fahr bin Malik bin Al-Nadr bin Kinana bin Khuzaymah bin Mudrikah bin Ilyas bin Mudar bin Nizar bin Ma’ad bin Adnan, whose lineage goes back to Ismail bin Ibrahim - peace and blessings be upon them both.
His grandfather Hashem and the story of the porridge:
Amr ibn Abd Manaf, the great-grandfather of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, was a generous man. It happened in his time that drought befell the people, and they did not find anything to eat, and they almost died of hunger, and every person began to think about saving himself only. Whoever has food is careful about it and hides it from people. So Amr went to his house and took out what food he had, and began crushing the porridge (i.e. breaking the bread in the broth) for his people and feeding them, so they called him (Hashim); Because he is generous, he breaks his porridge for all people.
When livelihood became tight in Mecca, Hashem wanted to ease the burden on its people, so he traveled to the Levant in the summer, and to Yemen in the winter. For the sake of trade, he was the first to teach people these two journeys. On one of the journeys, while Hashim was on his way to the Levant, he passed through Yathrib and married Salma bint Amr, one of the women of Banu al-Najjar. He left her while she was pregnant with his son, Abdul Muttalib, so that she could give birth among her family, who stipulated that he should do so when he married her.
His grandfather Abdul Muttalib and the story of the treasure:
Abdul Muttalib bin Hashim, the grandfather of the Noble Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to water the pilgrims who came to circumambulate the Kaaba, and he took care of the Sacred House of God, so the people gathered around him, so he was their leader and the most honorable of them. Abdul Muttalib wished he knew the location of the Zamzam Well so he could dig it. Because it had been filled in over the years, and no one knew its location anymore, so he saw in his dream one night the location of Zamzam Well, so he told his people about it, but they did not believe him. So Abdul Muttalib and his son Al-Harith began to dig the well, and the people mocked them. While they were digging, water gushes out from under their feet, and the people gathered around the well happily, and Abdul-Muttalib thought they would thank him, but he was surprised by them disputing with him the possession of the well. He felt wronged and weak because he had no sons except Al-Harith, and he could not support him, so he raised his hands to the sky, praying to God to grant him ten male sons, and vowed to slaughter one of them as an offering to God. The story of the ten sons:
God answered Abdul Muttalib’s prayer, and gave him ten children. Abdul Muttalib felt happy because his hope had been fulfilled, and he was blessed with children who would be his support and help, but his joy did not last long. He remembered the vow he had made to himself, so he must slaughter one of the...
His children. Abdul Muttalib thought for a long time, then he left the choice to God Almighty, so he drew lots among his children, and the lot fell on Abdullah, the youngest of his children and the most beloved to his heart, so he became
Abdul Muttalib is confused; Should he slaughter his beloved son or disobey God and not fulfill his vow?
So he consulted his people, and they advised him to repeat the lot, so he repeated it several times. But fate chose Abdullah every time, and Abdul Muttalib's anxiety increased, so a priestess advised him to ransom his son with camels, so lots were drawn between Abdullah and ten camels, and he continued to double their number, until the lot settled on the camels instead of his son, so Abdul Muttalib followed the advice of the priestess, and continued to double the number of camels until it reached one hundred camels, and then the lot fell on them, so he slaughtered them as a ransom for Abdullah, and all of Mecca rejoiced. Abdullah survived, and his father slaughtered a hundred camels for him, and Abdul Muttalib’s love for his son increased and showered him with his compassion and care. His father Abdullah and his blessed marriage to Mrs. Amna:
Abdullah was the most honorable of the Quraysh youth in morals, the most beautiful in appearance, and he wanted his father
Abdul Muttalib wanted him to marry him, so he chose a good wife for him, namely, Mrs. Amna bint Wahb bin Abd Manaf bin Zahra, the purest of the women of Bani Zahra, and the mistress of their women. Mrs. Amna shares her lineage with Abdullah, the father of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, in Kilab bin Murra. Days passed, and Abdullah went out on trade to the Levant, after he left his wife, Amna, pregnant, and according to a wisdom known to God, Abdullah died before seeing his child. Elephant tale:
One day, the people of Mecca woke up to news that terrified and terrified them. The King of Yemen, Abraha, had come to the Abyssinian Ashram with a large army, led by a huge elephant, wanting to demolish the Kaaba so that the pilgrims would turn to his church that he had built in Yemen, and spent on it.
A lot of money, and the army approached the Sacred House of God, and fear and panic appeared on the faces of the people of Mecca, and people gathered around Abdul Muttalib, who said to Abraha, with the confident tongue of God Almighty’s victory: (The House has a Lord who protects it). So Abraha became more stubborn and insisted on demolishing the Kaaba, so he directed the huge elephant towards it. When he approached it, the elephant turned its back and did not move. God sent birds from the sky carrying small, but very solid, stones that threw them over the heads of Abraha’s soldiers, killing them and destroying them. God Almighty said: {Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant? Did He not mislead their plots? And he sent flocks of birds against them. You throw stones of clay at them, and He makes them like edible straw.} [The Elephant] And in this year the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, was born.

number: ميلاد الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم وطفولته
label:
في يوم الاثنين الثاني عشر من شهر ربيع الأول الذي يوافق عام (175م) ولدت السيدة آمنة بنت وهب زوجة عبد الله بن عبد المطلب غلامًا جميلا، مشرق الوجه، وخرجت ثويبة الأسلمية خادمة أبي لهب -عم النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم- تهرول إلى سيدها أبي لهب، ووجهها ينطق بالسعادة، وما كادت تصل إليه حتى همست له بالبشرى، فتهلل وجهه، وقال لها من فرط سروره:
اذهبي فأنت حرة! وأسرع عبد المطلب إلى بيت ابنه عبد الله ثم خرج حاملا الوليد الجديد، ودخل به الكعبة مسرورًا كأنه يحمل على يديه كلَّ نعيم
الدنيا، وأخذ يضمه إلى صدره ويقبله في حنان بالغ، ويشكر الله ويدعوه، وألهمه الله أن يطلق على حفيده اسم محمد.
حكاية مرضعة الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم:
جاءت المرضعات من قبيلة بني سعد إلى مكة؛ ليأخذن الأطفال الرُّضَّع إلى البادية حتى ينشئوا هناك أقوياء فصحاء، قادرين على مواجهة أعباء الحياة، وكانت كل مرضعة تبحث عن رضيع من أسرة غنية ووالده حي؛ ليعطيها مالاً كثيرًا، لذلك رفضت كل المرضعات أن يأخذن محمدًا صلى الله عليه وسلم لأنه يتيم، وأخذته السيدة حليمة السعدية لأنها لم تجد رضيعًا غيره، وعاش محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم في قبيلة بني سعد، فكان خيرًا وبركة على حليمة وأهلها، حيث اخضرَّت أرضهم بعد الجدب والجفاف، وجرى اللبن في ضروع الإبل.
حكاية شق الصدر:
وفي بادية بني سعد وقعت حادثة غريبة، فقد خرج محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم ذات يوم ليلعب مع أخيه من الرضاعة ابن حليمة السعدية، وفي أثناء لعبهما ظهر رجلان فجأة، واتجها نحو محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم فأمسكاه، وأضجعاه على الأرض ثم شقَّا صدره، وكان أخوه من الرضاعة يشاهد عن قرب ما يحدث
له، فأسرع نحو أمه وهو يصرخ، ويحكى لها ما حدث.
فأسرعت حليمة السعدية وهي مذعورة إلى حيث يوجد الغلام القرشي فهو أمانة عندها، وتخشى عليه أن يصاب بسوء، لكنها على عكس ما تصورت، وجدته واقفًا وحده، قد تأثر بما حدث، فاصفر لونه، فضمته في حنان إلى
صدرها، وعادت به إلى البيت، فسألته حليمة: ماذا حدث لك يا محمد؟ فأخذ يقص عليها ما حدث، لقد كان هذان الرجلان ملكين من السماء أرسلهما الله تعالى؛ ليطهرا قلبه ويغسلاه، حتى يتهيأ للرسالة العظيمة التي سيكلفه الله بها.
خافت حليمة على محمد، فحملته إلى أمه في مكة، وأخبرتها بما حدث
لابنها، فقالت لها السيدة آمنة في ثقة: أتخوفتِ عليه الشيطان؟ فأجابتها حليمة: نعم، فقالت السيدة آمنة: كلا والله ما للشيطان عليه من سبيل، وإن لابني
لشأنًا؛ لقد رأيت حين حملت به أنه خرج مني نور، أضاء لي به قصور
الشام، وكان حَمْلُه يسيرًا، فرجعت به حليمة إلى قومها بعد أن زال الخوف من قلبها، وظل عندها حتى بلغ عمره خمس سنوات، ثم عاد إلى أمه في مكة.
رحلة محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم مع أمه إلى يثرب:
وذات يوم، خرجت السيدة آمنة ومعها طفلها محمد وخادمتها أم أيمن من مكة متوجهة إلى يثرب؛ لزيارة قبر زوجها عبد الله، وفاء له، وليعرف ولدها قبر
أبيه، ويزور أخوال جده من بني النجار، وكان الجو شديد الحر، وتحملت أعباء هذه الرحلة الطويلة الشاقة، وظلت السيدة آمنة شهرًا في المدينة، وأثناء عودتها مرضت وماتت وهي في الطريق، في مكان يسمى الأبواء، فدفنت فيه، وعادت
أم أيمن إلى مكة بالطفل محمد يتيمًا وحيدًا، فعاش مع جده عبدالمطلب، وكان عمر محمد آنذاك ست سنوات.

محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم في كفالة جده عبد المطلب:
بعد وفاة السيدة آمنة عاش محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم في ظل كفالة جده عبدالمطلب الذي امتلأ قلبه بحب محمد، فكان يؤثر أن يصحبه في مجالسه
العامة، ويجلسه على فراشه بجوار الكعبة، ولكن عبدالمطلب فارق الحياة ومحمد في الثامنة من عمره.
محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم في كفالة عمه أبي طالب:
وتكفَّل به بعد وفاة جده عمه أبو طالب، فقام بتربيته ورعايته هو وزوجته فاطمة بنت أسد، وأخذه مع أبنائه، رغم أنه لم يكن أكثر أعمام النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم مالا، لكنه كان أكثرهم نبلا وشرفًا، فزاد عطفه على محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم حتى إنه كان لا يجلس في مجلس إلا وهو معه، ويناديه بابنه من شدة حبه له.
رحلة إلى الشام:
خرج محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم مع عمه أبو طالب في رحلة إلى الشام مع القوافل التجارية وعمره اثنا عشر عامًا، وتحركت القافلة، ومضت في
طريقها؛ حتى وصلت إلى بلدة اسمها (بصرى) وأثناء سيرها مرت بكوخ يسكنه راهب اسمه (بُحَيْرَى) فلما رأى القافلة خرج إليها، ودقق النظر في وجه محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم طويلا، ثم قال لأبي طالب: ما قرابة هذا الغلام منك؟ فقال أبوطالب: هو ابني -وكان يدعوه بابنه حبًّا له- قال بحيرى: ما هو بابنك، وما ينبغي أن يكون هذا الغلام أبوه حيًّا، قال أبو طالب: هو ابن أخي، فسأله بحيرى: فما فعل أبوه؟ قال أبو طالب: مات وأمه حبلى به؟ فقال له بحيرى: صدقت! فارجع به إلى بلده واحذر عليه اليهود!! فوالله لئن رأوه هنا ليوقعون به شرًّا، فإنه سيكون لابن أخيك هذا شأن عظيم، فأسرع أبو طالب بالعودة إلى مكة وفي صحبته ابن أخيه محمد.
number-en: The birth of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and his childhood
label-en:
On Monday the twelfth of the month of Rabi’ al-Awwal, which corresponds to the year 175 AD, Mrs. Amna bint Wahab, the wife of Abdullah bin Abdul Muttalib, gave birth to a beautiful boy, with a radiant face. Thuwaibah al-Aslamiyah, the maid of Abu Lahab - the uncle of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, came out running to her master Abu Lahab, with her face expressing happiness. She had barely reached him before she whispered good news to him, and his face lit up, and he said to her out of his great happiness:
Go, you are free! Abdul Muttalib hurried to his son Abdullah’s house, then he went out carrying the new newborn, and entered the Kaaba with him happily, as if he was carrying all the blessings on his hands.
world, and he began to hug him to his chest and kiss him with great tenderness, thanking God and praying to him, and God inspired him to name his grandson Muhammad.
The story of the wet nurse of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace:
Breastfeeding women from the Banu Saad tribe came to Mecca. To take the infants to the desert so that they could grow up strong and healthy, able to face the burdens of life. Every wet nurse was looking for an infant from a rich family whose father was alive. To give her a lot of money, Therefore, all the breastfeeding mothers refused to take Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, because he was an orphan, and Mrs. Halima al-Saadia took him because she did not find an infant other than him. Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, lived in the Bani Saad tribe, so he was good and a blessing for Halima and her family, as their land became green after barrenness and drought, and milk flowed from the udders of camels. The story of the chest split:
In the desert of Bani Saad, a strange incident occurred. Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, went out one day to play with his breast-feeding brother, Ibn Halima al-Saadia. While they were playing, two men suddenly appeared and headed towards Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him. They grabbed him, laid him on the ground, and then cut open his chest. His breast-feeding brother was watching closely what was happening.
He ran to his mother, screaming, and told her what happened. Halima Al-Saadia, terrified, hurried to where the Qurashi boy was. He was a trustworthy person for her, and she feared that he might be harmed. However, contrary to what she had imagined, she found him standing alone, affected by what had happened, and his color turned yellow, so she hugged him tenderly to her.
Her chest, and she brought it home, so Halima asked him: What happened to you, Muhammad? So he started telling her what happened. These two men were angels from heaven sent by God Almighty. To purify and wash his heart, so that he can prepare himself for the great mission that God will entrust him with. Halima was afraid for Muhammad, so she took him to his mother in Mecca and told her what had happened
To her son, Mrs. Amna said to her confidently: Do you fear the devil for him? Halima answered her: Yes, and Mrs. Amna said: No, by God, Satan has no way against him, even against my son
for a matter; When I became pregnant with him, I saw that a light came out of me, and it illuminated palaces for me
Damascus, and his burden was easy, so Halima returned him to her people after the fear had disappeared from her heart, and he remained with her until he was five years old, then he returned to his mother in Mecca. Muhammad’s journey, may God bless him and grant him peace, with his mother to Yathrib:
One day, Mrs. Amna, with her child, Muhammad, and her maid, Umm Ayman, left Mecca, heading to Yathrib. To visit the grave of her husband Abdullah, out of loyalty to him, and so that her son would know his grave
His father, and he was visiting his grandfather’s maternal uncles from Bani al-Najjar. The weather was very hot, and she endured the burdens of this long, arduous journey. The woman remained safe for a month in the city, and during her return she fell ill and died on the way, in a place called Al-Abwaa, so she was buried there and returned.
Umm Ayman took the child Muhammad to Mecca, an orphan alone, and he lived with his grandfather Abdul Muttalib. Muhammad was six years old at the time. Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, in the sponsorship of his grandfather Abdul Muttalib:
After the death of Mrs. Amna, Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, lived under the care of his grandfather Abdul Muttalib, whose heart was filled with love for Muhammad, and he preferred to accompany him in his gatherings.
The public, and made him sit on his bed next to the Kaaba, but Abdul Muttalib died when Muhammad was eight years old. Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, in the sponsorship of his uncle Abu Talib:
After the death of his grandfather, his uncle Abu Talib, he took care of him. He raised and cared for him and his wife, Fatima bint Asad, and took him with his children. Although he was not the most wealthy of the uncles of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, he was the most noble and honorable of them. His compassion for Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, increased to the point that he would not sit in a gathering unless he was with him, and would call him his son out of the intensity of his love for him. A trip to the Levant:
Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, went out with his uncle Abu Talib on a trip to the Levant with commercial caravans when he was twelve years old. The caravan moved and went on.
her way; Until it reached a town called (Busra), and while walking it passed a hut inhabited by a monk named (Buhaira). When he saw the caravan, he went out to it and looked closely at the face of Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, for a long time. Then he said to Abu Talib: How close is this boy to you? Abu Talib said: He is my son - and he used to call him his son out of love for him. Buhairi said: He is not your son, and this boy should not have a living father. Abu Talib said: He is my brother’s son, so Buhairi asked him: What did his father do? Abu Talib said: He died and his mother was pregnant with him? Bahiri said to him: You are right! So return him to his country and beware of the Jews!! By God, if they saw him here, they would harm him, but this son of yours would be of great importance, so Abu Talib hastened to return to Mecca with his nephew Muhammad in his company.
