كان الشباب في مكة يلهون ويعبثون، أما محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم فكان يعمل ولا يتكاسل؛ يرعى الأغنام طوال النهار، ويتأمل الكون ويفكر في خلق الله، وقد ذكر النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم -بعد أن أوتي النبوة- ذلك العمل، فقال: (ما بعث الله نبيًّا إلا رعى الغنم) فقال أصحابه: وأنت؟ قال: (نعم، كنتُ أرعاها على قراريط لأهل مكة) [البخاري] وكان الله -سبحانه- يحرسه ويرعاه على الدوام؛ فذات يوم فكر أن يلهو كما يلهو الشباب، فطلب من صاحب له أن يحرس أغنامه، حتى ينزل مكة ويشارك الشباب في لهوهم، وعندما وصل إليها وجد حفل زواج، فوقف عنده، فسلط الله عليه النوم، ولم يستيقظ إلا في صباح اليوم التالي.
وعندما كانت قريش تجدد بناء الكعبة، كان محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم ينقل معهم الحجارة للكعبة وعليه إزاره، فقال له العباس عمه: اجعل إزارك على رقبتك يقيك الحجارة، ففعل، فخر إلى الأرض، وجعل ينظر بعينيه إلى
السماء، ويقول: إزاري.. إزاري، فشد عليه، فما رؤى بعد ذلك عريانًا.
التاجر الأمين:
وحين جاوز النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم العشرين من عمره أُتيحت له فرصة السفر مع قافلة التجارة إلى الشام، ففي مكة كان الناس يستعدون لرحلة الصيف التجارية إلى الشام، وكل منهم يعد راحلته وبضاعته وأمواله، وكانت السيدة خديجة بنت خويلد -وهي من أشرف نساء قريش، وأكرمهن أخلاقًا، وأكثرهن مالا- تبحث عن رجل أمين يتاجر لها في مالها ويخرج به مع القوم، فسمعت عن محمد وأخلاقه العظيمة، ومكانته عند أهل مكة جميعًا ، واحترامهم له؛ لأنه صادق أمين، فاتفقت معه أن يتاجر لها مقابل مبلغ من المال، فوافق محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم وخرج مع غلام لها اسمه ميسرة إلى الشام.
تحركت القافلة في طريقها إلى الشام، وبعد أن قطع القوم المسافات
الطويلة نزلوا ليستريحوا بعض الوقت، وجلس محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم تحت شجرة، وعلى مقربة منه صومعة راهب، وما إن رأى الراهب محمدًا صلى الله عليه وسلم حتى أخذ ينظر إليه ويطيل النظر، ثم سأل ميسرة: من هذا الرجل الذي نزل تحت هذه الشجرة؟ فقال ميسرة: هذا رجل من قريش من
أهل الحرم، فقال الراهب: ما نزل تحت هذه الشجرة إلا نبي، وباعت القافلة كل تجارتها، واشترت ما تريد من البضائع، وكان ميسرة ينظر إلى محمد ويتعجب من سماحته وأخلاقه والربح الكبير الذي حققه في مال السيدة خديجة.
وفي طريق العودة حدث أمر عجيب، فقد كانت هناك غمامة في السماء تظل محمدًا وتقيه الحر، وكان ميسرة ينظر إلى ذلك المشهد، وقد بدت على وجهه علامات الدهشة والتعجب، وأخيرًا وصلت القافلة إلى مكة فخرج الناس لاستقبالها مشتاقين؛ كل منهم يريد الاطمئنان على أمواله، وما تحقق له
من ربح، وحكى ميسرة لسيدته خديجة ما رأى من أمر محمد، فقد أخبرها بما قاله الراهب، وبالغمامة التي كانت تظل محمدًا في الطريق؛ لتقيه من الحر دون سائر أفراد القافلة.
زواج محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم من السيدة خديجة:
استمعت السيدة خديجة إلى ميسرة في دهشة، وقد تأكدت من أمانة محمد
صلى الله عليه وسلم وحسن أخلاقه، فتمنت أن تتزوجه، فأرسلت السيدة خديجة صديقتها نفيسة بنت منبه؛ لتعرض على محمد الزواج، فوافق محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم على هذا الزواج، وكلم أعمامه، الذين رحبوا ووافقوا على هذا
الزواج، وساروا إلى السيدة خديجة يريدون خطبتها؛ فلما انتهوا إلى دار خويلد قام أبو طالب عم النبي وكفيله يخطُب خُطبة العرس، فقال: (الحمد لله الذي جعلنا من ذرية إبراهيم وزرع إسماعيل، وجعل لنا بيتًا محجوجًا وحرمًا
آمنًا، وجعلنا أمناء بيته، وسُوَّاس حرمه، وجعلنا الحكام على الناس، ثم إن ابن أخي هذا محمد بن عبد الله لا يوزن به رجل شرفًا ونبلاً وفضلاً، وإن كان في المال قلا، فإن المال ظل زائل، وقد خطب خديجة بنت خويلد وبذل لها من الصداق ما عاجله وآجله من مالي كذا وكذا، وهو والله بعد هذا له نبأ
عظيم، وخطر جليل) وتزوج النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم السيدة خديجة، وعاشا معًا حياة طيبة موفقة، ورزقهما الله تعالى البنين والبنات، فأنجبت له ستة أولاد هم: زينب، ورقية، وأم كلثوم، وفاطمة، وعبدالله، والقاسم، وبه يكنى الرسول فيقال: أبو القاسم.
بناء الكعبة وقصة الحجر الأسود:
اجتمعت قريش لإعادة بناء الكعبة، وأثناء البناء اختلفوا فيمن ينال شرف وضع الحجر الأسود في مكانه، واشتد الخلاف بينهم، وكاد أن يتحول إلى حرب بين قبائل قريش، ولكنهم تداركوا أمرهم، وارتضوا أن يُحكِّموا أول داخل عليهم وانتظر القوم، وكل واحد يسأل نفسه: ترى من سيأتي الآن؟ ولمن سيحكم؟ وفجأة تهللت وجوههم بالفرحة والسرور عندما رأوا محمدًا يقبل عليهم، فكل واحدٍ منهم يحبه ويثق في عدله وأمانته ورجاحة عقله وسداد رأيه، فهتفوا: هذا الأمين قد رضيناه حَكَما، وعرضوا عليه الأمر وطلبوا منه أن يحكم بينهم، فخلع الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم رداءه ووضع الحجر عليه، ثم أمر رؤساء القبائل فرفعوا الثوب حتى أوصلوا الحجر إلى مكانه من الكعبة، عندئذ حمله الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم بيده الشريفة ووضعه مكانه، وهكذا كفاهم الله
شر القتال.
number-en: His youth, may God bless him and grant him peace
label-en:
The youth in Mecca were having fun and fooling around, but Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, was working and not being lazy. He grazes sheep all day long, contemplating the universe and thinking about God’s creation. The Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, mentioned that work after he was given the prophecy, and said: (God did not send a prophet except that he tended sheep) and his companions said: And you? He said: (Yes, I used to take care of it on karats for the people of Mecca) [Al-Bukhari] And God - Glory be to Him - was always guarding and taking care of him; One day, he thought of having fun like the youth had fun, so he asked a friend of his to guard his sheep, so he could go down to Mecca and join the youth in their fun. When he arrived there, he found a wedding party, so he stopped there, so God made him sleep, and he did not wake up until the next morning. When the Quraysh were rebuilding the Kaaba, Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was transporting stones to the Kaaba with them while wearing his garment. His uncle Abbas said to him: Place your garment on your neck to protect you from the stones. So he did so, so he fell to the ground and looked at the stones with his eyes.
The sky, and he said: My garment.. My garment, so he tightened it, and after that he was not seen naked. Honest merchant:
When the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was over twenty years old, he was given the opportunity to travel with a trade caravan to the Levant. In Mecca, people were preparing for the summer trade trip to the Levant, and each of them was preparing his mount, his goods, and his money. Mrs. Khadija bint Khuwaylid - who was one of the most honorable women of Quraysh, the most generous of their morals, and the most wealthy - was looking for an honest man who would trade her money for her and go out with the people, so she heard about Muhammad and his morals. His great status among all the people of Mecca, and their respect for him; Because he is honest and trustworthy, she agreed with him to trade for her in exchange for a sum of money. Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, agreed and went out with a boy of hers named Maysarah to the Levant.
The caravan moved on its way to the Levant, after the people had covered the distances
Al-Tawila went down to rest for a while, and Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, sat under a tree, and near him was a monk’s cell. As soon as the monk saw Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he began to look at him and look for a long time, then he asked Maysara: Who is this man who came down under this tree? Maysarah said: This is a man from Quraish
People of the Sanctuary, and the monk said: Only a prophet descended under this tree, and the caravan sold all its trade, and bought whatever goods it wanted, and Maysarah was looking at Muhammad and marveling at his tolerance and morals and the great profit he had made with the money of Mrs. Khadija.
On the way back, a strange thing happened. There was a cloud in the sky that remained Muhammad and his pious free man, and Maysarah was looking at that scene, and signs of astonishment and wonder appeared on his face. Finally, the caravan arrived in Mecca, and the people came out to receive it eagerly. Everyone wants to be sure of their money. And what he achieved
Whoever won, and Maysarah told his lady Khadija what he saw about Muhammad’s affairs, he told her what the monk said, and about the cloud that was shadowing Muhammad on the road; To protect him from the heat without the rest of the caravan members.
The marriage of Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, to Lady Khadija:
Mrs. Khadija listened to Maysara in amazement, and she was convinced of Muhammad's honesty
May God bless him and grant him peace, and his good morals, she wished to marry him, so Mrs. Khadija sent her friend Nafisa bint Munabbih. To propose marriage to Muhammad, Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, agreed to this marriage, and spoke to his uncles, who welcomed and agreed to this.
marriage, They walked to Mrs. Khadija, wanting to propose to her. When they reached Khuwaylid’s house, Abu Talib, the uncle of the Prophet and his sponsor, stood up to deliver the wedding sermon, and said: (Praise be to God who made us among the descendants of Abraham and seeded Ishmael, and made for us a protected house and a sanctuary.
We made him the trustees of his house, the guardians of his sanctuary, and we made the rulers over the people. Then, this nephew of mine, Muhammad ibn Abdullah, cannot be compared to a man in honor, nobility, or merit, and if there is little money, then the money is fleeting. He proposed to Khadija bint Khuwaylid and gave her the dowry, current and future money, such-and-such, and he, by God, will have news after this.
Great, And a great danger) The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, married Mrs. Khadija, and they lived a good and successful life together, and God Almighty blessed them with sons and daughters, and she gave birth to him six children: Zainab, Ruqayyah, Umm Kulthum, Fatima, Abdullah, and Al-Qasim, and this is the nickname of the Messenger, and it is said: Abu Al-Qasim.
The construction of the Kaaba and the story of the Black Stone:
The Quraysh gathered to rebuild the Kaaba, and during construction they disagreed about who would have the honor of placing the Black Stone in its place. The dispute between them intensified, and almost turned into a war between the Quraysh tribes, but they reconciled their matter and were satisfied to rule over the first one who entered upon them, and the people waited. Everyone asks himself: Who will come now? Who will rule? Suddenly their faces lit up with joy and happiness when they saw Muhammad approaching them. Every one of them loved him and trusted him in his justice, his honesty, his sound mind, and his judgment. So they chanted: “This trustworthy person we have accepted as an arbitrator.” They presented the matter to him and asked him to rule between them. So the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, took off his robe and placed the stone on it. Then he ordered the tribal leaders to lift the robe until they brought the stone to its place from the Kaaba. Then the Messenger carried it to its place from the Kaaba. May God bless him and grant him peace, with his noble hand, and put him in his place, and thus God sufficed them
The evil of fighting.

label:
كان محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم يكثر من الذهاب إلى غار حراء، فيجلس وحده فيه أيامًا بلياليها؛ يفكر في خالق هذا الكون بعيدًا عن الناس وما يفعلونه
من آثام، ولقد كان يمشي تلك المسافة الطويلة ويصعد ذلك الجبل العالي، ثم يعود إلى مكة ليتزود بالطعام ويرجع إلى ذلك الغار، وظل مدة لا يرى رؤيا إلا وتحققت كما رآها، وبدأت تحدث له أشياء عجيبة لا تحدث لأي إنسان
آخر، فقد كان في مكة حَجَر يسلم عليه كلما مر به، قال صلى الله عليه وسلم: (إني لأعرف حجرًا بمكة كان يسلم عليَّ قبل أن أبعث، إني لأعرفه
الآن) [مسلم].
وكان النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم يجلس ذات يوم في الغار، وإذا بجبريل -عليه السلام- ينزل عليه في صورة رجل ويقول له: اقرأ. وكان النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم لا يعرف القراءة ولا الكتابة، فخاف وارتعد، وقال للرجل: ما أنا بقارئ. وإذا بجبريل -عليه السلام- يضم النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم إليه بشدة، ثم يتركه ويقول له: اقرأ. فقال محمد: ما أنا بقارئ. وتكرر ذلك مرة ثالثة، فقال جبريل: {اقرأ باسم ربك الذي خلق . خلق الإنسان من علق . اقرأ وربك الأكرم} _[العلق:1-3]. فكانت هذه أولى آيات القرآن التي نزلت في شهر رمضان على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم وهو في السنة الأربعين من عمره.
رجع محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى بيته مسرعًا، ثم رقد وهو يرتعش، وطلب من زوجته أن تغطيه قائلا: (زملونى، زملونى) وحكى لها ما رآه في الغار، فطمأنته السيدة خديجة، وقالت له: كلا والله لا يخزيك الله أبدًا، إنك لتصل الرحم وتحمل الكلَّ (الضعيف) وتُكسب المعدوم، وتُقري (تكرم) الضيف، وتعين على نوائب الحق، فلما استمع النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى كلام السيدة خديجة، عادت إليه الطمأنينة، وزال عنه الخوف والرعب، وبدأ يفكر فيما حدث.



حكاية ورقة بن نوفل:
وكان للسيدة خديجة ابن عم، اسمه (ورقة بن نوفل) على علم بالديانة المسيحية فذهبت إليه ومعها زوجها؛ ليسألاه عما حدث، فقالت خديجة لورقة: يابن عم اسمع من ابن أخيك، فقال ورقة: يابن أخي ماذا ترى؟ فأخبره النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم بالذي حدث في غار حراء، فلما سمعه ورقة قال: هذا الناموس الذي كان ينزل على موسى، ثم أخبره (ورقة) أنه يتمنى أن يعيش حتى ينصره، ويكون معه عندما يحاربه قومه، ويُخرجونه من مكة، فلما سمع الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ذلك تعجب وسأل ورقة قائلا: أو مُخرجيَّ هم؟ فقال له: نعم، لم يأتِ أحد بمثل ما جئت به إلا عُودِيَ، ومنذ ذلك اليوم والرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يزداد شوقًا لوحي السماء الذي تأخر نزوله عليه بعد هذه المرة.
عودة الوحي:
وبعد فترة، وبينما كان النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم يمشي إذا به يسمع صوتًا، فرفع وجهه إلى السماء، فرأى الملك الذي جاءه في غار حراء جالسًا على كرسي بين السماء والأرض، فارتعد الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم من هول المنظر، وأسرع إلى المنزل، وطلب من زوجته أن تغطيه، قائلا: دثرونى . دثرونى، وإذا بجبريل ينزل إليه بهذه الآيات التي يوجهها الله إليه: {يا أيها المدثر . قم فأنذر . وربك فكبر . وثيابك فطهر . والرجز فاهجر} _[المدثر: 1-5] وفي هذه الآيات تكليف من الله سبحانه لرسوله صلى الله عليه وسلم أن يدعو الناس.
الدعوة إلى الإسلام سرَّا:
كان الناس في مكة يعبدون الأصنام منذ زمن بعيد، وقد ورثوا عبادتها عن آبائهم وأجدادهم؛ فبدأ الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم بالدعوة إلى الإسلام سرَّا، وبدأ بأقرب الناس إليه، فآمنت به زوجته خديجة بنت خويلد، وآمن به أيضًا ابن عمه علي بن أبي طالب، وكان غلامًا في العاشرة من عمره، وكان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم هو الذي يقوم بتربيته، وكان صديقه أبو بكر أول الذين آمنوا به من الرجال، وكان ذا مكانة عظيمة بين قومه، يأتي الناس إليه ويجلسون
معه، فاستغل أبو بكر مكانته هذه وأخذ يدعو من يأتي إليه ويثق فيه
إلى الإسلام، فأسلم على يديه عبدالرحمن بن عوف، وعثمان بن عفان، والزبير ابن العوام، وطلحة بن عبيد الله .. وغيرهم.
ولم تكن الصلاة قد فرضت في ذلك الوقت بالكيفية التي نعرفها، ولكن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم كان يصلي بأصحابه الذين أسلموا سرًّا ركعتين قبل طلوع الشمس وركعتين قبل الغروب، وذلك في مكان بعيد عن أعين
الكفار.
وذات يوم كان الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يصلي بأصحابه في شِعبٍ من شِعَابِ مكة، إذ أقبل عليهم أبو طالب عم النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم والذي لم يؤمن برسالته، فلما رأى الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم وأصحابه يصلون، سأله عن هذا الدين الجديد، فأخبره الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم به لأنه يثق في عمه ويأمل أن يدخل الإسلام، ولكن أبا طالب رفض أن يترك دين آبائه وأجداده وطمأن النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم وتعهد بحمايته من أعدائه، وأوصى ابنه عليًّا أن يلزم رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، واستمر الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يدعو قومه سرَّا، وعدد المسلمين يزداد يومًا بعد يوم، ويقوى الإيمان في قلوبهم بما ينزله الله عليهم من القرآن الكريم، وظلوا هكذا ثلاث سنوات.
label-en:
Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, would often go to the cave of Hira, and would sit alone there for days and nights. He thinks about the Creator of this universe apart from people and what they do
Of sins, he used to walk that long distance and climb that high mountain, then return to Mecca to obtain food and return to that cave, and for a while he did not see a vision without it coming true as he saw it, and strange things began to happen to him that would not happen to any human being.
Another, there was a stone in Mecca that he greeted whenever he passed by. He, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: (I know a stone in Mecca that used to greet me before I was sent. I know him.
Now) [Muslim]. One day the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, was sitting in the cave, and suddenly Gabriel, peace be upon him, came down to him in the form of a man and said to him: Read. The Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, did not know how to read or write, so he was afraid and trembling, and said to the man: I am not a reader. Then Gabriel - peace be upon him - hugged the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, tightly to him, then let him go and said to him: Read. Muhammad said: I am not a reader. This was repeated a third time, and Gabriel said: {Read in the name of your Lord who created. Man was created from a clot. Read, and your Lord is the Most Generous} _[Al-Alaq: 1-3]. These were the first verses of the Qur’an that were revealed in the month of Ramadan to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, when he was in the fortieth year of his life.
Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, quickly returned to his house, then he lay down, trembling, and asked his wife to cover him, saying: “Zamlouni, Zamaloni,” and he told her what he saw in the cave. Lady Khadija reassured him and said to him: “No, by God, may God never disgrace you. You are close to the womb, you carry all (the weak), you support the needy, you honor (honour) the guest, and you help in the calamities of truth.” When the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, listened Peace be upon him, upon the words of Lady Khadija, peace returned to him. Fear and terror disappeared from him, and he began to think about what had happened.



The story of Waraqa bin Nawfal:
Mrs. Khadija had a cousin, named (Warqa bin Nawfal), who was knowledgeable about the Christian religion, so she went to him with her husband. To ask him about what happened, Khadija said to Waraqah: Cousin, listen to your nephew. Waraqah said: O nephew, what do you see? So the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, told him what had happened in the Cave of Hira. When Waraqah heard him, he said: This is the law that was revealed to Moses. Then Waraqa told him that he wished to live until he supported him, and to be with him when his people fought him and expelled him from Mecca. When the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, heard that, he was amazed and asked Waraqa, saying: Or are those who brought me out? He said to him: Yes, no one has brought anything like what you have brought except that it was repeated, and since that day the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, has been increasingly longing for the revelation from heaven, which was delayed in descending upon him after this time. The return of revelation:
After a while, while the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was walking, he heard a voice. He raised his face to the sky and saw the king who had come to him in the cave of Hira sitting on a chair between heaven and earth. The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, trembled from the horror of the sight. He hurried to the house and asked his wife to cover him, saying: Cover me. They covered me, and suddenly Gabriel came down to him with these verses that God directed to him: {O, O Muddathir! Arise and warn. And your Lord, so grow up. And your clothes are pure. And if you are angry, abandon it.} _[Al-Muddaththir: 1-5] And in these verses there is a mandate from God Almighty to His Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, to call upon the people.
Calling to Islam secretly:
People in Mecca have been worshiping idols for a long time, and they inherited their worship from their fathers and grandfathers. So the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, began to call to Islam secretly, and he started with the people closest to him. His wife, Khadija bint Khuwaylid, believed in him, and his cousin Ali bin Abi Talib also believed in him. He was a ten-year-old boy, and the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was the one raising him. His friend Abu Bakr was the first of the men to believe in him, and he had a great status among his people. People would come to him and sit.
With him, Abu Bakr took advantage of his position and began inviting those who would come to him and trust him
He converted to Islam, and Abdul Rahman bin Awf, Othman bin Affan, Al-Zubair bin Al-Awwam, and Talha bin Ubaidullah converted to Islam at his hands. And others.
Prayer was not imposed at that time in the way we know it, but the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, would lead his companions who had converted to Islam secretly to pray two rak’ahs before sunrise and two rak’ahs before sunset, in a place far from the eyes of the Prophet.
Infidels.
One day, the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, was praying with his companions in a street in Mecca, when Abu Talib, the uncle of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, who did not believe in his message, came to them. When he saw the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, and his companions praying, he asked him about this new religion. So the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, told him about it because he trusted his uncle and hoped that he would convert to Islam, but Abu Talib refused to leave the religion of his fathers and grandfathers and reassured the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and pledged to protect him from his enemies. He advised his son Ali to adhere to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, continued to call his people secretly, and the number of Muslims increased day after day, and the faith in their hearts strengthened in what God revealed to them of the Holy Qur’an, and they remained like this for three days. years.

مر الله سبحانه رسوله صلى الله عليه وسلم أن يجهر بالدعوة ويبدأ بعشيرته وأهله، فقال تعالى: {وأنذر عشيرتك الأقربين} _[الشعراء:214] فنادى الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم قريشًا، وقال: (يا بني كعب أنقذوا أنفسكم من النار، يا بني عبد شمس أنقذوا أنفسكم من النار، يا بني عبد مناف أنقذوا أنفسكم من النار، يا بني هاشم وبني عبد المطلب أنقذوا أنفسكم من النار، يا فاطمة أنقذي نفسك من النار، فإني والله لا أملك لكم من الله شيئًا إلا أن لكم رحمًا سأَبُلُّهَا بِبِلالِهَا (سَأصِلُها) ) _[مسلم].
ونزل هذا الكلام على قلوب الكفار نزول الصاعقة، فقد أصبحت المواجهة واضحة بينهم وبين رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، إنه يطلب منهم أن يتركوا الأصنام التي يعبدونها، وأن يتركوا الفواحش، فلا يتعاملون بالربا، ولا يزنون، ولا يقتلون أولادهم، ولا يظلمون أحدًا، لكنهم قابلوا تلك الدعوة بالرفض، وبدءوا يسخرون من النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، ومن دعوته، فصبر صلى الله عليه وسلم عليهم وعلى تطاولهم.
وذات مرة، كان النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم يطوف بالبيت، فتطاول عليه بعض الكفار بالكلام، ولكنه صبر عليهم ومضى، فلما مرَّ عليهم ثانية تطاولوا عليه بمثل ما فعلوا، فصبر ولم يرد، ثم مرَّ بهم الثالثة، فتطاولوا عليه بمثل ما فعلوا أيضًا، فقال صلى الله عليه وسلم لهم: (أتسمعون يا معشر قريش؟ أما والذي نفسي بيده، لقد جئتكم بالذبح) فخاف القوم حتى إن أكثرهم وقاحة أصبح يقول للرسول
صلى الله عليه وسلم بكل أدب: انصرف يا أبا القاسم، انصرف راشدًا، فوالله ما كنت جهولا.
وذات يوم، أقبل رجل من بلد اسمها (إراش) إلى مكة، فظلمه أبو جهل، وأخذ منه إبله، فذهب الرجل إلى نادي قريش يسألهم عن رجل ينصره على
أبي جهل، وهنا وجد الكفار فرصة للتسلية والضحك والسخرية من رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، فأمروا الرجل أن يذهب إلى الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ليأخذ له حقه، فذهب الرجل إلى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، وأخذوا ينظرون إليه ليروا ما سيحدث، فقام النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم مع الرجل ليعيد له حقه من أبي جهل، فأرسلوا وراءه أحدهم؛ ليرى ما سوف يصنعه أبوجهل مع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، فذهب الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى بيت أبي جهل، وطرق بابه، فخرج أبو جهل من البيت خائفًا مرتعدًا، وقد تغير لونه من شدة الخوف، فقال له رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم: (أعطِ هذا الرجل حقه) فرد أبو جهل دون تردد: لا تبرح حتى أعطيه الذي له، ودخل البيت مسرعًا، فأخرج مال الرجل، فأخذه، وانصرف.
وعندما أقبل أبو جهل على قومه بادروه قائلين: ويلك! ما بك؟ فقال لهم: والله ما هو إلا أن ضرب عليَّ وسمعت صوته فملئت منه رعبًا، ثم خرجت إليه، وإن فوق رأسه لفحلا من الإبل ما رأيتُ مثلَه قط، فوالله لو أبَيتُ لأكلني. [البيهقي]
وبدأ كفار قريش مرحلة جديدة من المفاوضات، فذهبوا إلى أبي طالب عم النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، وقالوا له: يا أبا طالب، إن ابن أخيك قد سبَّ
آلهتنا، وعاب ديننا، وسفه أحلامنا، وضلل آباءنا، فإما أن تكفه عنا، وإما أن تخلى بيننا وبينه، فردَّ عليهم أبو طالب ردًّا رقيقًا، فانصرفوا عنه.
ولكن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم استمر في إظهار دين الله ودعوة الناس إليه، فجمع الكفار أنفسهم مرة أخرى وذهبوا إلى أبي طالب، فقالوا له: يا أبا طالب، إن لك سنًّا وشرفًا ومنزلة فينا، وإنا قد استنهيناك من ابن أخيك فلم تنهه عنا، وإنا والله لا نصبر على هذا من شتم آبائنا، وتسفيه أحلامنا، وعيب
آلهتنا، حتى تكفه عنا، أو ننازله وإياك في ذلك حتى يهلك أحد الفريقين.
وأرسل أبو طالب إلى النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، فلما جاء قال له: يابن أخي! إن قومك قد جاءوني، وقالوا كذا وكذا فأَبقِ علىَّ وعلى نفسك، ولا تُحملني من الأمر ما لا أطيق أنا ولا أنت، فاكفف عن قومك ما يكرهون من قولك، فقال النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم لعمه: (والله يا عم لو وضعوا الشمس في يميني والقمر في يساري، ما تركت هذا الأمر حتى يظهره الله أو أهلك فيه) فقال أبو طالب: امضِ على أمرك وافعل ما أحببت، فوالله! لا أسلمك لشيء أبدًا.
لم يستطع المشركون أن يوقفوا مسيرة الدعوة للإسلام، ولم يستطيعوا إغراء الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم بالمال أو بالجاه، وقد خاب أملهم في عمه
أبي طالب، وها هو ذا موسم الحج يقبل، والعرب سوف يأتون من كل
مكان، وقد سمعوا بمحمد ودعوته، وسوف يستمعون إليه وربما آمنوا به
ونصروه، فتسرب الخوف إلى قلوب الكفار في مكة، وفكروا في قول واحد يتفقون عليه ويقولونه عن محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم حتى يصرفوا العرب
عنه، فالتفوا حول الوليد بن المغيرة، وكان أكبرهم سنًّا؛ فقال أحدهم: نقول إن محمدًا كاهن، فقال الوليد: والله ما هو بكاهن، لقد رأينا الكهان فما هو بزمزمة الكاهن ولا سجعه، فقالوا: نقول إن محمدًا مجنون، فقال لهم: ما هو بمجنون لقد رأينا الجنون وعرفناه، فقالوا: نقول إن محمدًا شاعر، فقال لهم: ما هو بشاعر لقد عرفنا الشعر كله فما هو بالشعر، فقالوا: نقول ساحر، فقال لهم: ما هو
بساحر، لقد رأينا السحرة وسحرهم وما هو منهم.
فقالوا للوليد بن المغيرة: فما تقول يا أبا عبد شمس؟ فأقسم لهم أن كلام محمد هو أحلى الكلام وأطيبه، وما هم بقائلين من هذا شيئًا إلا عُرف أنه باطل، وإن أقرب القول فيه أن تقولوا: إن محمدًا ساحر يفرق بين المرء وأخيه وبين الرجل وزوجته والرجل وأبيه، فوافق الكفار على رأيه وانتشروا في موسم الحج يرددون هذه الافتراءات بين الناس، حتى يصدوهم عن دعوة رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، فأنزل الله تعالى في الوليد بن المغيرة قوله: {ذرني ومن خلقت
وحيدًا . وجعلت له مالاً ممدودًا . وبنين شهودًا . ومهدت له تمهيدًا . ثم يطمع أن أزيد . كلا إنه كان لآياتنا عنيدًا . سأرهقه صعودًا . إنه فكر وقدر . فقتل كيف قدر . ثم قتل كيف قدر . ثم نظر . ثم عبس وبسر . ثم أدبر
واستكبر . فقال إن هذا إلا سحر يؤثر . إن هذا إلا قول البشر . سأصليه
سقر . وما أدراك ما سقر . لا تبقي ولا تذر . لواحة للبشر . عليها تسعة عشر} _[المدثر:11-30].
إسلام عمر بن الخطاب:
دعا الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم الله أن يعز الإسلام بأحد العمرين: عمر بن الخطاب، أو عمرو بن هشام، وكان عمر بن الخطاب قبل أن يسلم شديد الإيذاء للمسلمين، وذات يوم حمل عمر سيفه، وانطلق يبحث عن محمد ليقتله، وفي الطريق قابله رجل، وأخبره أن أخته فاطمة قد أسلمت هي وزوجها سعيد بن زيد، فاتجه عمر غاضبًا نحو دار أخته، ودق الباب، وكان الصحابي خباب بن الأَرَتِّ -رضي الله عنه- يعلِّم أخت عمر وزوجها القرآن الكريم، فلما سمعوا صوت عمر امتلأت قلوبهم بالرعب والخوف، وأسرع خباب فاختبأ في زاوية من البيت، ودخل عمر فقال: لقد أُخبرت أنكما تبعتما محمدًا على دينه، ثم ضرب زوج أخته، وضرب أخته على وجهها حتى سال الدم من وجهها، ولكنها لم تخف، وقالت له في ثبات وشجاعة: نعم أسلمنا وآمنا بالله ورسوله، فاصنع ما شئت.
ندم عمر على ما صنع بأخته، وطلب منها الصحيفة التي كانوا يقرءون
منها، فقالت له: يا أخي إنك نجس وإنه لا يمسه إلا المطهرون، فقام عمر فاغتسل، فأعطته الصحيفة، فقرأ عمر: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم {طه . ما أنزلنا عليك القرآن لتشقى . إلا تذكرة لمن يخشى . تنزيلاً ممن خلق الأرض والسموات العلى . الرحمن على العرش استوى . له ما في السموات وما في الأرض وما بينهما وما تحت الثرى . وإن تجهر بالقول فإنه يعلم السر
وأخفى . الله لا إله إلا هو له الأسماء الحسنى} _[طه:1-8].
وكانت هذه الآيات نورًا جذب عمر إلى الإسلام وأضاء له طريق الحق، فما إن قرأها حتى لان قلبه، وهدأ طبعه، وذهب عنه الغضب، وقال -والإيمان يفيض في جوانحه-: ما أحسن هذا الكلام وما أكرمه، ثم ذهب إلى النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم وأعلن إسلامه، وبعد قليل من إسلام عمر بن الخطاب -رضي الله
عنه- سار رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى الكعبة في وضح النهار بين عمر بن الخطاب وحمزة بن عبدالمطلب -رضي الله عنهما- وامتنع أصحاب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم بهما، وكان المسلمون لا يقدرون أن يُصَلُّوا عند الكعبة حتى أسلم عمر بن الخطاب، فلما أسلم هو وحمزة بن عبدالمطلب صلى المسلمون عند الكعبة.

God Almighty commanded His Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, to speak out loudly with the call and begin with his clan and his family, and God Almighty said: {And warn your closest clan}_[Al-Shu’ara’: 214] So the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, called out to the Quraysh and said: (O Banu Ka’b, save yourselves from the Fire, O Banu Abd Shams, save yourselves from the Fire, O Banu Abd Manaf, save yourselves from the Fire, O Banu Hashim). And the children of Abdul Muttalib, save yourselves from the Fire. O Fatima, save yourself from the Fire, for by God, I do not possess anything for you from God except that you have a womb that I will moisten with my wetness (I will moisten it))_[Muslim]. These words fell on the hearts of the infidels like a thunderbolt. The confrontation became clear between them and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. He asked them to abandon the idols they worship, and to abandon immoral acts, not to deal in usury, not to commit adultery, not to kill their children, and not to oppress anyone. But they rejected that call, and they began to mock the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and his call, so he, may God bless him and grant him peace, was patient with them and their arrogance. One time, the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was circumambulating the House, and some infidels verbally attacked him, but he was patient with them and went on. When he passed by them a second time, they attacked him in the same way they did, so he was patient and did not respond. Then he passed by them a third time, and they attacked him in the same way they did as well, so he, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to them: (Do you hear, O people of Quraysh? By the One in whose hand is my soul, I have brought you slaughter.) The people were so frightened that the most impudent of them began to say to the Messenger.
May God’s prayers and peace be upon him, with all politeness: Go away, O Abu al-Qasim. Go away wisely, for by God, you are not ignorant. One day, a man from a country called (Irash) came to Mecca, and Abu Jahl wronged him and took his camels from him. So the man went to the Quraysh club to ask them about a man who would support him.
Abu Jahl, and here the infidels found an opportunity to have fun, laugh, and make fun of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, so they ordered the man to go to the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, to obtain his rights. So the man went to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and they began to look at him to see what would happen, so the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, stood up with the man to return his rights to him from Abu Jahl. So they sent someone after him. To see what Abu Jahl would do with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, so the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, went to Abu Jahl’s house and knocked on his door. Abu Jahl left the house frightened and trembling, and his color had changed from intense fear. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said to him: (Give this man his due). Abu Jahl replied without hesitation: Don’t leave until I give him what is his. He entered the house quickly, took out the man’s money, took it, and left. When Abu Jahl approached his people, they rushed to him and said: Woe to you! What is with you? He said to them: By God, he only attacked me, and I heard his voice, so I was filled with terror. Then I went out to him, and above his head was a stallion of camels, the likes of which I had never seen. By God, if I refused, he would have eaten me. [Al-Bayhaqi]
The infidels of Quraish began a new phase of negotiations. They went to Abu Talib, the uncle of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said to him: O Abu Talib, your nephew has insulted you.
Our gods, he insulted our religion, he made foolish of our dreams, and he misled our fathers. Either you stop him from us, or you leave us alone with him. Abu Talib responded to them with a gentle response, so they turned away from him. But the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, continued to show the religion of God and call people to it, so the infidels gathered themselves again and went to Abu Talib, and they said to him: O Abu Talib, you have age, honor, and status among us, and we have prohibited you from your nephew, but you did not prohibit him from us, and by God we cannot be patient with this of cursing our fathers, making our dreams foolish, and disgraceful.
Our gods, until you spare him from us, or we will contest with him and you in this matter until one of the two parties perishes. Abu Talib sent to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and when he came, he said to him: O my nephew! Your people have come to me and said such-and-such, so spare me and yourself, and do not burden me with a matter that neither you nor I can bear, so restrain your people from saying what they hate. Then the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to his uncle: (By God, uncle, if they put the sun in my right hand and the moon in my left, I would not leave this matter until God makes it victorious or I perish in it.) So Abu Talib said: Go ahead and do what you like, by God! I will never hand you over to anything. The polytheists were unable to stop the process of calling to Islam, nor were they able to tempt the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, with money or prestige, and their hope in his uncle was disappointed.
Abu Talib, and here the Hajj season is approaching, and Arabs will come from all over the world
A place, and they had heard of Muhammad and his call, and they would listen to him and perhaps believe in him
They supported him, so fear seeped into the hearts of the infidels in Mecca, and they thought of one saying that they would agree on and say about Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, so that they would turn away the Arabs.
About him, they gathered around Al-Walid bin Al-Mughirah, who was the eldest of them. One of them said: We say that Muhammad is a priest. Al-Walid said: By God, he is not a soothsayer. We have seen soothsayers, but he does not have the squeak or rhyme of a soothsayer. They said: We say that Muhammad is crazy. He said to them: He is not crazy. We have seen madness and we know it. They said: We say that Muhammad is a poet. He said to them: He is not a poet. We have known all poetry, so what is poetry? They said: We say a magician. So he said to them: What is he?
With a magician, we have seen magicians and their magic and what is of them. They said to Al-Walid bin Al-Mughirah: What do you say, Abu Abd Shams? So he swore to them that the words of Muhammad are the sweetest and kindest words, and they did not say anything of this except that it was known that it was false, and the closest thing to saying about it is for you to say: Muhammad is a magician who separates between a man and his brother and between a man and his wife and a man and his father. So the infidels agreed with his opinion and spread out during the Hajj season repeating these slanders among the people, so as to deter them from the call of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, so God Almighty revealed regarding Al-Walid ibn Al-Mughirah his saying: {Leave me and those who I created
Alone. And I made for him an extended property. And sons are witnesses. And I made preparations for him. Then he hopes for more. No, he was stubborn towards Our signs. I will wear him down. It is thought and destiny. So he was killed as he could. Then he was killed as he could. Then he looked. Then he frowned and smiled. Then manage
And he was arrogant. He said: This is nothing but magic that has an effect. This is nothing but what humans say. I will pray it
Saqr. How do you know what has settled? Do not keep or leave. An oasis for humans. On it are nineteen} _[Al-Muddaththir: 11-30].
Omar bin Al-Khattab’s conversion to Islam:
The Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, called on God to strengthen Islam through one of the two ages: Omar ibn al-Khattab, or Amr ibn Hisham. Before he converted to Islam, Omar ibn al-Khattab was very abusive to Muslims. One day, Omar took up his sword and went looking for Muhammad to kill him. On the way, a man met him and told him that his sister Fatima had converted to Islam with her husband Saeed ibn Zaid. So Omar went angrily towards his sister’s house and knocked on the door, and the companion Khabab ibn al-Art - may God be pleased with him - was there. About him - he teaches Omar’s sister and her husband the Holy Qur’an. When they heard Omar's voice, their hearts were filled with terror and fear, and Khabbab hurried and hid in a corner of the house, and Omar entered and said: I was told that you followed Muhammad in his religion. Then he beat his sister's husband, and he beat his sister in the face until blood flowed from her face, but she was not afraid, and she said to him with steadfastness and courage: Yes, we converted to Islam and believed in God and His Messenger, so do whatever you want.
Omar regretted what he had done to his sister, and asked her for the newspaper they were reading
From it, she said to him: O brother, you are impure and only the cleansed can touch it. So Omar got up and took a bath, so she gave him the newspaper, and Omar recited: In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful {Taha. We did not send down the Qur’an to you so that you should be miserable. Only a reminder for those who fear. A revelation from Him who created the earth and the highest heavens. The Most Gracious is stationed above the Throne. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the earth. If you speak loudly, he knows the secret
And he hid. Allah, there is no god but Him. To Him belongs the best names} _[Taha: 1-8]. These verses were a light that attracted Omar to Islam and illuminated for him the path of truth. As soon as he read them, his heart softened, his nature calmed down, and his anger went away. He said - with faith overflowing within him -: How good and honorable these words are. Then he went to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and announced his conversion to Islam, and after a short while, Omar bin Al-Khattab - may God be pleased with him - converted to Islam.
On his authority - The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, walked to the Kaaba in broad daylight between Omar bin Al-Khattab and Hamza bin Abdul Muttalib - may God be pleased with them - but the companions of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, refrained from taking them. The Muslims were unable to pray at the Kaaba until Omar bin Al-Khattab converted to Islam. When he and Hamza bin Abdul Muttalib converted to Islam, the Muslims prayed at the Kaaba.

أصبحت مكة سجنًا كبيرًا يعذب فيه ضعفاء المسلمين، فهذا أمية بن خلف يُخرج عبده بلال بن رباح -رضي الله عنه- في حر الظهيرة ويطرحه على ظهره عريانًا فوق الرمال المحرقة، ويضع على صدره صخرة كبيرة، كل هذا العذاب لأن بلالا أسلم وسيده يريد منه أن يكفر بمحمد ويعبد الأصنام، لكن بلالا كان قوي الإيمان صلب العقيدة، لم يلن ولم يستسلم، وكان يردد قائلا: أحد .. أحد. وتحمل كل هذا العذاب حتى فَرَّجَ الله عنه.
وعُذِّبَ المسلمون داخل بيوتهم؛ فهذا مصعب بن عمير قد حبسته أمه، ومنعت عنه الطعام، وجمعت أخواله حتى يعذبوه ليترك الإسلام، وهكذا أصبحت مكة مكانًا غير مأمون على المسلمين، فتعذيب الكفار لهم يزداد يومًا بعد يوم، ففكر النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم في مكان يطمئن فيه على أصحابه، فوقع اختياره على الحبشة، فأمر أصحابه ممن يطيقون الهجرة بالتوجه إليها، لأن فيها ملكًا لا يُظلم عنده أحد، وخرج بعض المسلمين المهاجرين إلى هناك سرًّا، وكان من بينهم عثمان بن عفان وزوجته رقية بنت النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، وجعفر بن أبي طالب وزوجته أسماء بنت عميس، وعبدالله بن مسعود -رضي الله عنهم- وغيرهم.
ولما علم أهل قريش بذلك اشتد غيظهم ورفضوا أن يتركوا المسلمين المهاجرين إلى الحبشة وشأنهم، بل صمموا على إرجاعهم إلى مكة، فاختاروا من بينهم رجلين معروفين بالذكاء، وهما: عمرو بن العاص وعبدالله بن أبي بلتعة وأرسلوهما بهدايا إلى ملك الحبشة، فدخل عمرو بن العاص على النجاشي، وقال له: أيها الملك، إنه ضَوَى (جاء) إلى بلدك منا سفهاء، فارقوا دين قومهم، ولم يدخلوا في دينكم، وجاءوا بدين مبتدع، لا نعرفه نحن ولا أنتم، وقد بعثنا إلى الملك فيهم آباؤهم وأعمامهم وعشائرهم؛ لتردهم إليهم، فهم أعلى بهم عينًا وأعلم بما عابوا عليهم، فرفض النجاشي أن يسلِّم المسلمين لهم، حتى يبعث إليهم ويتأكد من صحة كلام عمرو وصاحبه.
فأرسل النجاشي في طلب المسلمين المهاجرين إلى بلاده فجاءوا إليه، وأنابوا جعفر بن أبي طالب -رضي الله عنه- حتى يتحدث باسمهم، فسأله النجاشي: ما هذا الدين الذي قد فارقتم به قومكم، ولم تدخلوا في ديني، ولا في دين أحد من هذه الملل؟ فَرَدَّ عليه جعفر قائلا: أيها الملك، كنا قومًا أهل جاهلية، نعبد الأصنام، ونأكل الميتة، ونأتي الفواحش، ونقطع الأرحام، ونسيء الجوار، ويأكل القوي منا الضعيف، فكنا على ذلك حتى بعث الله إلينا رسولا منا، نعرف
نسبه، وصدقه، وأمانته، وعفافه، فدعانا إلى الله لنوحده ونعبده، ونخلع ما كنا نعبد نحن وآباؤنا من دونه من الحجارة والأوثان، وأمرنا بصدق الحديث، وأداء الأمانة، وصلة الرحم، وحسن الجوار، والكف عن المحارم والدماء، ونهانا عن الفواحش، وقول الزور، وأكل مال اليتيم، وقذف المحصنات.
وأمرنا أن نعبد الله وحده ولا نشرك به شيئًا، وأمرنا بالصلاة والزكاة والصيام فصدَّقناه وآمنا به، واتبعناه على ما جاء به من الله، فعبدنا الله وحده فلم نشرك به شيئًا، وحرمنا ما حرم علينا، وأحللنا ما أحل لنا، فعدا علينا قومُنا فعذبونا وفتنونا عن ديننا، ليردونا إلى عبادة الأوثان عن عبادة الله -تعالى- وأن نستحل ما كنا نستحل من الخبائث، فلما قهرونا وظلمونا وضيَّقوا علينا، وحالوا بيننا وبين ديننا، خرجنا إلى بلادك، واخترناك على من سواك، ورغبنا في جوارك، ورجونا أن لا نُظلَم عندك أيها الملك، فقال له النجاشي: هل معك مما جاء به الله من شيء؟ قال جعفر: نعم. فقال النجاشي: اقرأه عليَّ.
فقرأ عليه جعفر أول سورة مريم، فبكى النجاشي، ثم قال: إن هذا والذي جاء به عيسى ليخرج من مشكاة واحدة، ثم قال لعمرو وصاحبه: انطلقا، فلا والله لا أسلمهم إليكما، وردَّ النجاشي الهدايا إلى عمرو ولم يسلم المسلمين إليه، وهكذا فشل المشركون في الإيقاع بين المسلمين وملك الحبشة.
label-en:
Mecca became a large prison in which weak Muslims were tortured. This is Umayyah ibn Khalaf, who took out his servant Bilal ibn Rabah - may God be pleased with him - in the heat of the afternoon and threw him on his back naked on the burning sand, and placed a large rock on his chest. All this torture was because Bilal had converted to Islam and his master wanted him to disbelieve in Muhammad and worship idols, but Bilal was strong in faith and firm in his belief. He did not relent or surrender, and he would repeat, saying: One... one. He endured all this torment until God relieved him.
Muslims were tortured inside their homes. This is Musab bin Umair. His mother imprisoned him, prevented him from eating, and gathered his maternal uncles to torture him so that he would leave Islam. Thus, Mecca became an unsafe place for the Muslims, as the torture of the infidels increased day after day. So the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, thought of a place where he could reassure himself of his companions, so his choice fell on Abyssinia, so he ordered his companions who could bear to emigrate to go there, because there was a king under whom no one would be oppressed, and some of the Muslim immigrants went out there secretly, and among them was Uthman. Bin Affan and his wife Ruqayyah, daughter of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, Jaafar bin Abi Talib and his wife Asma bint Umays, Abdullah bin Masoud - may God be pleased with them - and others.
When the people of Quraish learned of this, their anger intensified and they refused to leave the Muslims who had migrated to Abyssinia alone. Rather, they were determined to return them to Mecca, so they chose from among them two men known for their intelligence, namely: Amr ibn al-Aas and Abdullah ibn Abi Balta’a, and they sent them with gifts to the king of Abyssinia. Amr ibn al-Aas entered upon the Negus and said to him: O king, some fools have come to your country. They departed from the religion of their people, and did not enter into your religion, and they came with an innovated religion, which neither we nor you know, and we sent to the king among them their fathers, uncles, and clans. To return them to them, as they were more knowledgeable than them and more knowledgeable about what they criticized, so Al-Najashi refused to hand over the Muslims to them, until he sent to them and verified the veracity of the words of Amr and his companion.
So Al-Najashi sent for the Muslim immigrants to his country, and they came to him, and they appointed Jaafar bin Abi Talib - may God be pleased with him - to speak on their behalf, so Al-Najashi asked him: What is this religion that you have left your people with, and you have not entered into my religion, nor into the religion of any of these sects? Jaafar replied to him, saying: O king, we were a people of pre-Islamic times. We worshiped idols, ate dead meat, committed immoral acts, cut ties of kinship, treated bad neighbors, and the strong among us ate the weak. So we were like that until God sent to us a messenger from among us, whom we know.
His lineage, honesty, honesty, and chastity, so he called us to God to unite him and worship him, and to put off the stones and idols that we and our fathers used to worship besides him. He commanded us to speak truthfully, fulfill trusts, maintain family ties, be good neighbors, and abstain from forbidden things and bloodshed. He forbade us from immoral acts, false speech, consuming an orphan’s wealth, and slandering chaste women.
He commanded us to worship God alone and not to associate anything with Him, and He commanded us to pray, to pay zakat, and to fast, so we believed in him and believed in him, and we followed him in what he brought from God. So we worshiped God alone and did not associate anything with Him, and we forbade what was forbidden to us, and we made lawful what was lawful for us, so our people attacked us and tortured us and tempted us from our religion, to return us to the worship of idols rather than the worship of God - the Most High - and to make lawful what we had made lawful of the evil things. When they oppressed us, oppressed us, put pressure on us, and prevented us from our religion, we went out to your country, and we chose you over everyone else, and we desired your side, and we hoped that we would not be oppressed by you, O king. Then the Negus said to him: Do you have anything of what God has brought? Jaafar said: Yes. The Negus said: Read it to me.
So Ja'far recited to him the first of Surah Maryam, and the Negus cried, then he said: This and what Jesus brought came out of a single niche. Then he said to Amr and his companion: Go, no, by God, I will not hand them over to you. The Negus returned the gifts to Amr and did not hand over the Muslims to him, and thus the polytheists failed to create a trap between the Muslims and the king of Abyssinia.

ازداد عدد المسلمين، وانضم إليهم عدد من أصحاب القوة والسيطرة، فأصبح من الصعب على المشركين تعذيبهم، ففكروا في تعذيب من نوع آخر، يشمل كل المسلمين قويهم وضعيفهم، بل يشمل كل من يحمي النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم والمسلمين حتى ولو لم يدخل في الإسلام، فقرر المشركون أن يقاطعوا بني هاشم ومن معهم، فلا يزوجونهم ولا يتزوجون منهم، ولا يبيعون لهم ولا يشترون منهم، ولا يكلمونهم، ولا يدخلون بيوتهم، وأن يستمروا هكذا حتى يُسلِّموا إليهم محمدًا ليقتلوه أو يتركوا دينهم، وأقسم المشركون على هذا العهد، وكتبوه في صحيفة وعلقوها داخل الكعبة.
وأحكم المشركون الحصار، فاضطر الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ومن معه إلى الاحتباس في شعب بني هاشم، وكان رجال قريش ينتظرون التجار القادمين إلى مكة ليشتروا منهم الطعام ويمنعوا المسلمين من شرائه، فيظلوا على جوعهم، فهذا أبو لهب يقول لتجار قريش عندما يرى مسلمًا يشترى طعامًا لأولاده: يا معشر التجار، غالوا على أصحاب محمد؛ حتى لا يدركوا معكم شيئًا، فيزيدون عليهم في السلعة، حتى يرجع المسلم إلى أطفاله، وهم يتألمون من الجوع، وليس في يديه شيء يطعمهم به.
ويذهب التجار إلى أبي لهب فيربحهم فيما اشتروا من الطعام واللباس، حتى تعب المؤمنون ومن معهم من الجوع والعرى، واستمر هذا الحصار على بني هاشم والمسلمين مدة ثلاث سنوات، ولكن المسلمين أثبتوا أنهم أقوى من كل حيل المشركين، فإيمانهم راسخ في قلوبهم لا يزحزحه جوع ولا عطش، حتى وإن اضطروا إلى أكل أوراق الشجر، فلم ييأسوا، ولم ينفضُّوا من حول نبيهم صلى الله عليه وسلم.
وشعر بعض المشركين بسوء ما يفعلونه، فقرروا إنهاء هذه المقاطعة الظالمة وأرسل الله تعالى الأرضة (دودة أو حشرة صغيرة تشبه النملة) فأكلت صحيفتهم، ولم تُبْقِ إلا اسم الله تعالى، وأوحى الله إلى نبيه بذلك، فأخبر النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم عمه أبا طالب بما حدث للصحيفة، فذهب أبو طالب إلى الكفار وأخبرهم بما أخبره محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم به، فأسرعوا إلى الصحيفة، فوجدوا ما قاله أبو طالب صدقًا، وتقدم من المشركين هشام بن عمرو، وزهير بن أبي أمية والمطعم بن عدى، وأبو البختري بن هشام، وزمعة بن الأسود، فتبرءوا من هذه المعاهدة، وبذلك انتهت المقاطعة بعد ثلاث سنوات من الصبر، والثبات
والتحمل.
label-en:
The number of Muslims increased, and a number of those with power and control joined them, so it became difficult for the polytheists to torture them, so they thought of another kind of torture, which would include all Muslims, strong and weak, but would include everyone who protects the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and the Muslims, even if he did not convert to Islam. So the polytheists decided to boycott Bani Hashim and those with them, so that they would not marry them or marry them, nor sell to them, nor buy from them, nor speak to them, nor enter their homes, and to continue like this until They would hand over Muhammad to them so that they would kill him or leave their religion. The polytheists swore an oath to this covenant, wrote it on a newspaper and hung it inside the Kaaba.
The polytheists tightened the siege, so the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, and those with him were forced to be detained in the people of Bani Hashim. The men of Quraish were waiting for the merchants coming to Mecca to buy food from them and prevent the Muslims from buying it, so they remained hungry. This is Abu Lahab saying to the merchants of Quraish when he saw a Muslim buying food for his children: O merchants, you have exaggerated against the companions of Muhammad. So that they do not realize anything with you, so they increase them in goods, until the Muslim returns to his children, and they are suffering from hunger, and he has nothing in his hands to feed them with.
The merchants go to Abu Lahab, and he profits them from the food and clothing they bought, until the believers and those with them tired of hunger and nakedness. This siege on Bani Hashem and the Muslims continued for three years, but the Muslims proved that they are stronger than all the tricks of the polytheists, for their faith is firmly rooted in their hearts and cannot be moved by hunger or thirst, even if they were forced to eat tree leaves. They did not despair, nor did they disperse from around their Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace.
Some of the polytheists felt bad about what they were doing, so they decided to end this unjust boycott. God Almighty sent the earth (a small worm or insect that resembles an ant), which ate their newspaper, leaving only the name of God Almighty. God revealed this to His Prophet, so the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, informed his uncle Abu Talib of what had happened to the newspaper. Abu Talib went to the infidels and told them what Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, had told him. They hurried to the newspaper, and they found What Abu Talib said was true, and the polytheists Hisham bin Amr, Zuhair bin Abi Umayyah, Al-Mut’im bin Adi, Abu Al-Bakhtari bin Hisham, and Zamaa bin Al-Aswad came forward and disavowed this treaty, and thus the boycott ended after three years of patience and steadfastness.
And endurance.

في العام العاشر من البعثة كانت الأحزان على موعد مع الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم، فقد مات عمه أبو طالب الذي كان يحميه من أهل مكة، ثم ماتت زوجته الوفية الصادقة السيدة خديجة -رضي الله عنها- التي كانت تخفف عنه، وتؤيده في دعوته إلى الله -عز وجل- وهي التي آمنت به وساعدته بمالها، ورزقه الله منها الأولاد، فكان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يحبها ويقدرها، وبشرها الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم بالجنة -قبل موتها- فقد أتى جبريل -عليه السلام- النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم فقال: (يا رسول الله، هذه خديجة قد أتت معها إناء فيه إدام، أو طعام، أو شراب، فإذا هي أتتك فاقرأ عليها السلام من ربها
ومني، وبشِّرها ببيت في الجنة من قصب (المراد به لؤلؤة مجوفة واسعة كالقصر الكبير) لا صخب فيه ولا نصب) _[البخاري].
فحزن الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم حزنًا شديدًا على وفاة زوجته وعمه، وازداد قلقه على الدعوة، فقد فقد نصيرين كبيرين، وصدق ما توقعه الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم، فقد اشتد تعذيب المشركين له ولأصحابه.
زواج الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم من السيدة سودة:
كانت السيدة سودة بنت زمعة -رضي الله عنها- قد أسلمت في بداية الإسلام وهاجرت إلى الحبشة مع زوجها السكران بن عمرو، ثم عادت إلى مكة، وقد مات زوجها، فتزوجها الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم إكرامًا لها، ورحمة بها.
رحلة الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى الطائف
لم ييأس الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم بعد أن أعرض أهل مكة عن قبول الدعوة ولكنه بحث عن مكان آخر لنشر الدين، فأرض الله واسعة، وقد أرسله الله تعالى ليخرج الناس جميعًا من الظلمات إلى النور.
فسافر رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم ومعه خادمه زيد بن حارثة إلى الطائف وكان ذلك بعد مضي عشر سنوات من بعثته، وظل في الطائف عشرة أيام يدعو كبار القوم إلى الإسلام، ولكن الطائف لم تكن أحسن حالا من مكة، فقد رفض أهلها قبول دعوته، ولم يكتفوا بذلك، بل إنهم سَلَّطوا عليه صبيانهم وسفهاءهم فوقفوا صفين على طول طريق الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يسبونه، ويقذفونه بالحجارة هو وزيد بن حارثة الذي كان يدافع عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم بنفسه ويصد الحجارة، حتى جرح في رأسه، وسال الدم من قدم الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم.
عندئذ توجه الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى ربه، ولجأ إليه، ورفع يديه قائلا: (اللهم إليك أشكو ضعف قوتي وقلة حيلتي وهواني على الناس، يا أرحم الراحمين، أنت رب المستضعفين، وأنت ربي، إلى من تكلني، إلى بعيد
يتجهمني، أم إلى عدو ملكته أمري؟! إن لم يكن بك غضب عليَّ فلا أبالي، غير أن عافيتك هي أوسع لي، أعوذ بنور وجهك الذي أشرقت له الظلمات، وصلح عليه أمر الدنيا والآخرة أن يحل علي غضبك، أو أن ينزل بي سخطك، لك العتبى (التوبة والرجوع والاستغفار) حتى ترضى، ولا حول ولا قوة إلا بك)
[ابن إسحاق].
ووجد النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم بستانًا لعتبة وشيبة ابني ربيعة فجلس فيه يريح جسده المتعب لبعض الوقت، ورأى عتبة وشيبة رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم على هذه الحال، فرق قلبهما له مع أنهما مشركان، فأرسلا غلامهما عداسًا بعنقود من عنب، ليقدمه إلى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم فتناوله قائلا: بسم الله، فتعجب عداس، وقال: إن هذا الكلام لا يقوله أهل هذه البلاد -يعنى لا يقولون بسم الله- فسأله الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم عن دينه وبلده، فقال عداس: أنا نصراني من أهل نينوى، فقال له رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم:
(من قرية الرجل الصالح يونس بن متى؟) فقال عداس متعجبًا: وما يدريك ما يونس بن متى؟! فقال صلى الله عليه وسلم: (ذلك أخي كان نبيًّا وأنا نبي) فانكبَّ عداس على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يقبل رأسه ويديه وقدميه المجروحتين.
وفي طريق عودة رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى مكة، شاء الله أن يخفف عنه ما عاناه في الطائف، فعندما وقف يصلي الفجر مر به نفر من الجن، فاستمعوا له، فلما فرغ من صلاته رجعوا إلى قومهم وقد آمنوا بالله وبرسوله صلى الله عليه وسلم ، قال تعالى مخبرًا عن هذا: {قل أوحي إلي أنه استمع نفر من الجن فقالوا إنا سمعنا قرآنًا عجبًا يهدي إلى الرشد فآمنا به ولن نشرك بربنا أحدًا} _
[الجن: 1-2].
label-en:
In the tenth year of the mission, grief was upon the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace. His uncle Abu Talib, who was protecting him from the people of Mecca, died, then his loyal and sincere wife, Mrs. Khadija - may God be pleased with her - died, who had comforted him and supported him in his call to God - the Almighty - and she was the one who believed in him and helped him with her money, and God blessed him with children from her. And peace be upon him in Paradise - before her death - Gabriel - peace be upon him - came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: (O Messenger of God, This is Khadija. She brought with her a vessel containing meat, food, or drink. If she comes to you, read peace upon her from her Lord.
And from me, and give her good tidings of a house in Paradise made of reeds (what is meant is a hollow, spacious pearl like a large palace) in which there will be no noise or hardship) - [Al-Bukhari].
The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, was deeply saddened by the death of his wife and uncle, and his anxiety about the call increased, as he had lost two great supporters, and what the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, expected came true, as the polytheists’ torture of him and his companions intensified. The marriage of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, to Mrs. Sawda:
Mrs. Sawda bint Zam’a - may God be pleased with her - had converted to Islam at the beginning of Islam and migrated to Abyssinia with her husband, Al-Sakran bin Amr, then she returned to Mecca, and her husband had died, so the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, married her out of honor and mercy towards her.
The journey of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, to Taif
The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, did not despair after the people of Mecca refused to accept the call, but he looked for another place to spread the religion, for God’s land is vast, and God Almighty sent him to bring all people out of darkness into light. So the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, traveled with his servant Zaid bin Haritha to Taif, and that was ten years after his mission. He remained in Taif for ten days calling the elders of the people to Islam, but Taif was not in a better condition than Mecca. Its people refused to accept his call, and they were not satisfied with that. Rather, they imposed their children and fools on him, so they stood in two rows along the path of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, cursing him and throwing stones at him and Zaid. Bin Haritha, who was defending the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, by himself and repelling stones, until he was injured in the head. Blood flowed from the feet of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace.
Then the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, turned to his Lord, turned to Him, and raised his hands, saying: (O God, to You I complain of the weakness of my strength, my lack of resourcefulness, and my humiliation towards people. O Most Merciful of those who show mercy, You are the Lord of the oppressed, and You are my Lord, to whom do you entrust me, even far away?
He frowns at me, or at an enemy whose control is mine?! If you are not angry with me, then I do not care. However, your well-being is more important to me. I seek refuge in the light of your face, to which the darkness has shone, and the affairs of this world and the hereafter are right for him, whether your anger befalls me, or your anger befalls me. You are the one to repent (repent, return, and seek forgiveness) until you are satisfied, and there is no power or strength except with you.)
[Ibn Ishaq].
The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, found an orchard for Utbah and Shaybah, the two sons of Rabi’ah, and he sat in it to rest his tired body for a while. He saw Utbah and Shaybah of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, in this state. Their hearts were torn for him, even though they were polytheists, so they sent their boy to fetch a bunch of grapes. To present it to the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he took it and said: In the name of God. Then Addas was amazed and said: These words are not said by the people of this country - meaning they do not say in the name of God - so the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, asked him about his religion and his country, and Addas said: I am a Christian from the people of Nineveh, so the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to him:
(From the village of the righteous man Yunus bin Matta?) Addas said in astonishment: How do you know what Yunus bin Matta is?! He, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: (That is my brother. He was a prophet, and I am a prophet.) Then Addas leaned over to the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, kissing his wounded head, hands, and feet. On the way back of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, to Mecca, God wanted to alleviate what he had suffered in Taif. When he stood praying the dawn prayer, a group of jinn passed by him and they listened to him. When he finished praying, they returned to their people, and they believed in God and His Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace. God Almighty said, reporting this: It guides us to maturity, so we believe in Him, and we will not associate anyone with our Lord.}
[Al-Jinn: 1-2].

وهكذا أعرض أهل مكة عن الإسلام، وخذل أهل الطائف النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، وازداد إيذاء الكافرين له ولصحابته، وخاصة بعد وفاة السيدة
خديجة -رضي الله عنها- وعمه أبي طالب، وأراد الله -سبحانه- أن يخفف عن نبيه ، فأكرمه برحلة الإسراء والمعراج؛ فبينما كان الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم نائمًا بعد العشاء جاءه جبريل، فأيقظه وخرج به حتى انتهيا إلى دابة اسمها (البراق) تشبه البغل، ولها جناحان، فركب الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم البراق حتى وصل بيت المقدس في فلسطين، وصلى بالأنبياء ركعتين.
وهذه الرحلة من مكة إلى بيت المقدس تسمى (الإسراء) قال تعالى: {سبحان الذي أسرى بعبده ليلاً من المسجد الحرام إلي المسجد الأقصى الذي باركنا حوله لنريه من آياتنا إنه هو السميع البصير} _[الإسراء: 1].
ثم بدأت الرحلة السماوية من المسجد الأقصى إلى السماوات العلا وتسمى (المعراج) وإذا بأبواب السماء تفتح للنبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، فسلم على الملائكة، وظل يصعد من سماء إلى سماء يرافقه جبريل؛ فرأى الجنة والنار، ورأى من مشاهد الآخرة ما لم يره إنسان حتى وصل إلى سدرة المنتهى، وهو موضع لم يبلغه نبي أو ملك قبله ولا بعده تكريمًا له، قال تعالى: {فكان قاب قوسين أو أدنى . فأوحى إلى عبده ما أوحى} [النجم: 9-10] وفي هذه الليلة، فرض الله الصلوات الخمس على المسلمين، ثم نزل رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى بيت المقدس، وركب البراق عائدًا إلى مكة.
وفي الصباح، حكى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم لقومه ما حدث، فكذبوه وسخروا من كلامه، وأراد الكفار أن يختبروا صدق الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم، فطلبوا منه أن يصف بيت المقدس -ولم يكن رآه من قبل- فأظهر الله له صورة بيت المقدس، فأخذ يصفه وهو يراه، وهم لا يرونه، وأخبرهم الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم بأشياء رآها في الطريق، وبقوم مر عليهم وهم في طريقهم إلى مكة، فخرج الناس ينتظرونهم، فجاءوا في موعدهم الذي حدده النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم فشهدوا بصدقه.
وأسرع بعضهم إلى أبي بكر يقول له في استنكار: أسمعت ما يقول محمد؟ وكان أبو بكر مؤمنًا صادق الإيمان، فصدَّق الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم في كل ما قاله، فسماه الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم (الصديق) وهكذا كانت هذه الرحلة تسرية عن النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم، وتخفيفًا للأحزان التي مرَّ بها، وتأكيدًا من الله له على أنه قادر على نصرته، وكانت أيضًا ابتلاء للذين آمنوا حتى يميز الله الطيب من الخبيث.
label-en:
Thus, the people of Mecca turned away from Islam, and the people of Taif betrayed the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and the unbelievers’ abuse of him and his companions increased, especially after the death of Mrs.
Khadija - may God be pleased with her - and his uncle Abu Talib, and God - Glory be to Him - wanted to ease the burden of His Prophet, so he honored him with the journey of Isra and Mi’raj. While the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was sleeping after dinner, Gabriel came to him, woke him up, and took him out until they came to an animal named (Al-Buraq), which resembled a mule and had two wings. So the Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, rode Al-Buraq until he reached Jerusalem in Palestine, and prayed two rak’ahs with the prophets.
This journey from Mecca to Jerusalem is called (the Night Journey). God Almighty said: {Glory be to Him who took His servant by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Al-Aqsa Mosque, whose surroundings We have blessed to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearer, the All-Seeing} [Al-Isra: 1].
Then the heavenly journey began from Al-Aqsa Mosque to the highest heavens, and it is called (Al-Miraj), and suddenly the gates of heaven opened for the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he greeted the angels, and continued to ascend from heaven to heaven accompanied by Gabriel. He saw Paradise and Hell, and saw scenes of the Hereafter that no human being had seen until he reached Sidra al-Muntaha, a place that no prophet or king had reached before him or after him, in honor of him. God Almighty said: {And it was just around the corner. So He revealed to His servant what He revealed} [An-Najm: 9-10] On this night, God imposed the five daily prayers on Muslims, then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, descended to Jerusalem and rode Al-Buraq back to Mecca.
In the morning, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, told his people what had happened, but they lied to him and mocked his words. The infidels wanted to test the sincerity of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, so they asked him to describe Bayt al-Maqdis - and he had not seen it before. So God showed him a picture of Bayt al-Maqdis, so he began to describe it as he saw it, while they did not see it. The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, told them of things he saw on the road, and of people he passed by on their way to Mecca, so the people left. They were waiting for them, so they came at their appointment set by the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and they testified to his sincerity.
Some of them rushed to Abu Bakr and said to him in denunciation: Did you hear what Muhammad said? Abu Bakr was a sincere believer, so he believed the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, in everything he said, so the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, called him (the Truthful). Thus, this journey was a relief for the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, an alleviation of the sorrows he went through, and an assurance from God to him that he was able to support him. It was also a test for those who believed until God distinguished the good from the bad.

جاء موسم الحج في السنة العاشرة من البعثة، فاجتمعت القبائل من كل مكان وبدأ الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم يدعوهم قائلا: (يا أيها الناس، قولوا لا إله إلا الله تفلحوا، وتملكوا بها العرب، وتذل لكم العجم، وإذا آمنتم كنتم ملوكًا في الجنة) _[الطبراني وابن سعد] ووجد الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ستة رجال من (يثرب) يتحدثون، فاقترب منهم، وقال لهم: (من أنتم؟)
قالوا: نفر من الخزرج.
قال: أَمِنْ موالى يهود (أي من حلفائهم)؟
قالوا: نعم.
قال: أفلا تجلسون أكلمكم؟. قالوا: بلى.
فجلس معهم وحدثهم عن الإسلام، وتلا عليهم القرآن، فانشرحت له صدورهم، وظهرت علامات القبول على وجوههم، وكانت بينهم وبين اليهود عداوة، فكان اليهود يهددونهم بظهور نبي، وسوف يؤيدونه ويقاتلونهم معه، فلما سمعوا كلام الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم نظر بعضهم لبعض وقالوا: تعلمون والله إنه النبي الذي توعدكم به اليهود فلا يسبقُنَّكُم إليه .. فأجابوا الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم فيما دعاهم إليه، ووعدوه بأن يقابلوه في العام المقبل، ثم انصرفوا إلى قومهم وحدثوهم عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، فانتشرت أخباره في يثرب. _[ابن إسحاق].
بـيعة العقبة الأولى:
وفي شهر ذي الحجة سنة إحدى عشرة من البعثة، قدم إلى مكة اثنا عشر رجلا من أهل يثرب من بينهم خمسة من الستة الذين كلموا الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم في العام الماضي، واجتمع معهم رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم في مكان اسمه العقبة؛ فآمنوا به صلى الله عليه وسلم، وبايعوه على ألا يشركوا بالله
شيئًا، ولا يسرقوا، ولا يرتكبوا الفواحش والمنكرات، ولا يقتلوا أولادهم، ولا يعصوه صلى الله عليه وسلم في معروف يأمرهم به.
وكانت هذه هي بيعة العقبة الأولى، وعندما عادوا إلى يثرب أرسل رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم معهم مصعب بن عمير -رضي الله عنه- ليعلمهم أمور الدين ويقرأ عليهم القرآن، فأسلم على يديه كثير من أهل يثرب.
بـيعة العقبة الثانية:
وفي شهر ذي الحجة من العام الثاني عشر من البعثة، ذهب ثلاثة وسبعون رجلا وامرأتان من أهل يثرب إلى الحج، ليبايعوا رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم على الإسلام، وفي ليلة الحادي عشر من ذي الحجة تسلل الرجال والمرأتان وذهبوا إلى العقبة، وجاء إليهم الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم ومعه عمه العباس بن عبدالمطلب، ولم يكن قد آمن وقتئذ، ولكنه جاء ليطمئن على اتفاق ابن أخيه مع أهل يثرب، وليبين لهم أنه قادر على حمايته في مكة إن لم يكونوا قادرين على حمايته في المدينة.
وتمت بيعة العقبة الثانية، وفيها عاهد الأنصار النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم على السمع والطاعة، وقال لهم : (تبايعوني على السمع والطاعة، في النشاط
والكسل، وعلى النفقة في العسر واليسر، وعلى الأمر بالمعروف والنهي عن المنكر، وعلى أن تقولوا في الله لا تأخذكم لومة لائم، وعلى أن تنصروني إذا قدمت عليكم، وتمنعوني مما تمنعون منه أنفسكم وأزواجكم وأبناءكم
ولكم الجنة) _[أحمد].
وأصبح لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم أتباع أقوياء مستعدون لنصرته، والقتال من أجل الإسلام، حتى إن أحدهم وهو العباس بن عبادة -رضي الله عنه- قام وقال لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم: والله الذي بعثك بالحق، إن شئت لنميلن على أهل منى غدًا بأسيافنا، ولكن الرسول صلى الله عليه وسلم لا يفعل إلا ما يأمره الله به، فقال له : (لم نؤمر بذلك، ولكن ارجعوا إلى رحالكم)
[ابن إسحاق] واختار رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم منهم اثني عشر رجلا؛ ليكونوا أمراء عليهم حتى يهاجر إليهم.
وفي الصباح، تسلل الخبر إلى كفار قريش، فاكتشفوا أمر ذلك الاجتماع
الخطير، وخرجت قريش تطلب المسلمين من أهل يثرب فأدركوا (سعد بن عبادة) وأسروه وأخذوا يعذبونه ويَجُرُّونه حتى أدخلوه مكة، وكان سعد يجير ويحمي تجارة اثنين من كبار مكة إذا مرا ببلده، وهما جبير بن مطعم بن عدي والحارث بن حرب بن أمية، فنادى باسميهما فجاءا وخلصاه من أيدي
المشركين، وعاد سعد بن عبادة -رضي الله عنه- إلى يثرب.
label-en:
The Hajj season came in the tenth year of the mission, and the tribes gathered from everywhere and the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, began calling on them, saying: (O people, say there is no god but God and you will succeed, and with it you will possess the Arabs, and the non-Arabs will be humiliated for you, and if you believe, you will be kings in Paradise) - [Al-Tabarani and Ibn Saad] The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, found six men from Yathrib talking, so he approached them and said to them: (Who are you?)
They said: A group of Khazraj.
He said: Who is loyal to the Jews (i.e., one of their allies)?
They said: Yes.
He said: Will you not sit down and I will talk to you? They said: Yes.
So he sat with them and spoke to them about Islam, and recited the Qur’an to them. Their hearts were open to him, and signs of acceptance appeared on their faces. There was enmity between them and the Jews. The Jews were threatening them with the appearance of a prophet, and they would support him and fight them with him. When they heard the words of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, they looked at each other and said: You know, by God, that he is the prophet whom the Jews have threatened you with, so do not let us go before you. So they responded to the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, in what he called them to do. They promised to meet him next year, then they went to their people and told them about the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and news of him spread in Yathrib. _[Ibn Ishaq].
The First Pledge of Aqaba:
In the month of Dhul-Hijjah, the eleventh year of the mission, twelve men from the people of Yathrib came to Mecca, including five of the six who had spoken to the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, the previous year, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, met with them in a place called Aqaba. So they believed in him, may God bless him and grant him peace, and pledged allegiance to him not to associate anything with God
They do not steal anything, they do not commit immoral acts and evils, they do not kill their children, and they do not disobey him, may God bless him and grant him peace, in doing what he commands them to do.
This was the first pledge of allegiance to Aqaba, and when they returned to Yathrib, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, sent with them Musab bin Umair - may God be pleased with him - to teach them matters of religion and read to them the Qur’an, and many of the people of Yathrib converted to Islam at his hands.
The Second Pledge of Aqaba:
In the month of Dhul-Hijjah of the twelfth year of the mission, seventy-three men and two women from the people of Yathrib went to Hajj, to pledge allegiance to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, on Islam. On the night of the eleventh of Dhul-Hijjah, the men and two women sneaked out and went to Aqaba, and the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, came to them and with him was his uncle Abbas bin Abdul Muttalib. He had not believed at the time, but he came to reassure himself of his nephew’s agreement with the people of Yathrib, and to show them that he was capable of protecting him. In Mecca if they were not able to protect him in Medina.
The second pledge of allegiance to Aqaba was completed, and in it the Ansar pledged to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, to listen and obey, and he said to them: (You pledge your allegiance to me to listen and obey, in activity.
And laziness, and on spending in times of hardship and ease, and on enjoining what is right and forbidding what is evil, and so that you say in the name of God, do not let the blame of a blamer overtake you, and so that you support me when I come upon you, and prevent me from what you prevent yourselves, your wives, and your children from.
Paradise is yours)_[Ahmed].
The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, had strong followers who were ready to support him and fight for Islam, to the point that one of them, Al-Abbas ibn Ubadah - may God be pleased with him - stood up and said to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace: By God who sent you with the truth, if you wish, we will attack the people of Mina tomorrow with our swords, but the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, only does what God commands him to do, so he said to him: (We were not commanded to do that, but return to your travels.)
[Ibn Ishaq] The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, chose twelve men from them; To be their princes until he migrates to them.
In the morning, the news reached the infidels of Quraysh, and they discovered the matter of that meeting
Dangerous, and the Quraysh went out asking the Muslims from the people of Yathrib, so they found (Saad bin Ubadah) and captured him and began torturing him and dragging him until they brought him into Mecca. Saad was protecting and protecting the trade of two of the prominent people of Mecca when they passed through his country, and they were Jubayr bin Mutim bin Adi and Al-Harith bin Harb bin Umayyah, so he called their names, so they came and rescued him from the hands of
The polytheists, and Saad bin Ubadah - may God be pleased with him - returned to Yathrib.
